description:
I ordered the spicy sushi roll combo using MealPal and oh my goodness I was pleasantly surprised by how enormous the rolls were, and how tasty that side noodle salad was. If the MealPal meal is any indication of how great it would be to eat in or order anything else to go, this place should be a wonderful! 

With my meal I received 6 pieces of a spicy hamachi roll and 6 pieces of a spicy tuna roll. Each were delicious, tasted fresh and were perfectly spicy. The rolls were huge! I could barely finish everything - but I did hehe. In addition to the rolls I had the side noodle salad which consisted of veggies, skinny noodles and a heavy creamy sauce. Like the sushi, the side was cold but it had good flavor and I enjoyed it.

My order was ready when I went to pick it up and the man that helped me was so nice and smiley. The restaurant is located off Pine in Chinatown - right on the corner. You can't miss it. Highly recommend!
author: Bri T.

description:
I have had better  super market  sushi. The sashimi was cut into tiny cubes
 
There was no tempura for the tempura  undon.
 
The Goyza were dry and over cooked.

Grub hub basically imposed a tip on the bill ..'then their driver wouldn't even get out  of his car to come to the door!
 
Last tine I order here or grub hub
author: Jason P.

description:
Came here with some of my friends after telling them I'm craving Japanese food. Their track record of suggesting food places wasn't my liking, so I came here with low expectations. Well I'm so glad that my expectations was wrong! This was surprisingly very good. 

This place is located at China town...Chinese owner...so Japanese food at China town with a Chinese owner? Well I was surprise too. The fish was pretty fresh and everything was created nicely and presented beautifully. I've heard that depending on who the sushi chef is, the food differs. When we went the sushi chef that my friend liked wasn't there, so we didn't really order their rolls. 

The sashimi was super good. The fish was super fresh and tender. There was no additional flavoring except for the sweet taste of the fish and the nice saltiness of soy sauce. 

I would love coming back here again.
author: Drew R.

description: Stopped by this place with my boss last week. Ordered off the lunch menu. The combo sushi was delicious!
author: Ana K.

description:
Do you miss the second story restaurants that are dime a dozen in Asia but non existent in the US? Now you finally have one, and looking over one of the busier corners of Chinatown for that matter.

Altitude aside, the sushi isn't particularly notable with the exception of the fried shrimp heads - Order the sweet raw shrimp and 5 minutes later a pair of deep fried heads arrive that are 100% edible, antennae and all! (see pic for proof).

Even above the sushi, the owner (presumably) is extraordinarily kind, making sure I saved room for the best part and asking what I thought of them. Rock Japanese Cuisine could be a real 5 star knockout if the older looking interior had a fresh hip renovation.
author: Christopher D.

description: UPDATE: ALL MY FRIENDS AND I NOW HAVE FOOD POISONING FROM EATING HERE!! Do not eat here! This place is terrible! The waitress is rude, unhappy and is constantly sitting on her cell phone. They also ruined my order and gave me MEAT spring rolls instead of veggie rolls. I'm vegan and my body could've gone into shock and I'd have to be taken to the hospital. The waitress also hovers over us while we eat sometimes? The waitress also argued with me to try and change the story when I called the manager over to blame it on me instead of owning up to her mistake.
author: Chii W.

description:
My office orders lunch from Rock every week through DoorDash - they're a great deal for sushi in SF, quick and quite reliable. 

Have yet to visit in-person.
author: Michelle B.

description:
I had the chicken omu rice with beef. 

Food was fast even around peak dinner time, which was a plus. 

The combination of egg and curry tasted somewhat mismatched, but not too bad. I should've tried just the curry.

The beef was ok - it had a teriyaki-like taste to it. The serving size was also good, and I can see people with smaller stomachs not being able to finish.

For the price ($15) it was an ok deal.
author: John L.

description:
Ate lunch here while about Chinatown
 Parking in parking lot. Environment looked clean. Restroom outside. Lunch special lunch box ordered. Food was tasty. Fish tasted a little odd. Other items were very good.
author: Clifford W.

description: I had the vegetarian udon and it was very tasty! The noodles were nice a think and the broth was very rich but not overwhelming. We tried the sake and some of the rolls which were pretty good.
author: Gabriela N.

description: This honestly this place use to be my favorite place to go too and every once in a while I gave a tip even though the waiters not even that good, It's cause the food great but now all of a sudden they are FORCING a tip out people if you don't give one and they will sit there and wait for you to give a tip. I thought it was optional to give a tip? I also had 2 other people with who like the place but now we all won't be going back because of forcing tips.
author: Ariana B.

description: Excellent!  Had cherry blossom roll and egg rolls.  Service was great.  Complimentary coconut ice cream.  Would definitely come again!
author: Nicole L.

description:
Really disappointed. We ordered a Ramen bowl and some sushi. Sushi was ok, but tasted better, but for the price I couldn't really ask for. As for the Ramen; there are no words to describe how bad it was. We could not even eat it. To top the visit off we ask the waiter for an extra bowl as we were sharing plates; and was told he didn't have extra bowls.
Mmmm.... a restaurant that only has 1 bowl? Really? The place wasn't busy so I'm sure there was extra bowls somewhere.
author: Catherine H.

description:
Looking for a quick lunch near the Dragon Gate? This is a good place to try. We ordered two bento boxes for $12.95 each. That was plenty of tasty food right there. The teriyaki salmon and chicken was delicious, love the crispiness of the tempura shrimp and veggies. It came with miso soup, rice, and side salad with a dressing similar to thousand island. The only item I found lacking was the California roll. It was ok, nothing special but not bad either.

Everything was clean, and the server took care of us very well. Not sure why this place doesn't have a higher rating,  we didn't try the sushi but I would come back again for the bento box.
author: Nicole B.

description: Outstanding service and amazing food! Hospitality was great!! Waiters and greeters always kind and welcoming.
author: Alex A.

description:
Rich Dunn from L.D jewelry recommended this place to us while shopping. I ordered the miso ramen soup. It was delicious! I don't eat Japanese food often so I played it safe and got a ramen soup. I was not disappointed! I will be back when I'm back in San Francisco. 
After the soup they gave us a small cup of vanilla ice-cream:)
author: Roxanne C.

description: Love this place! Live close to it and for the last week visited it 3 times ) Food is always fresh and tasteful! People who work here are awesome, polite and professional! Price is reasonable. Really enjoy to eat here!
author: Elena A.

description:
We went to rock last night before we visited Chinatown.

The menu has a lot of choices. CAUTION the portion sizes are HUGE. We got the sashimi special and a few rolls and it was a ton of food for 2 people.

I'm not complaining! Just something to be mindful of.

They also gave us a little scoop of vanilla bean ice cream as a finisher at the end which was a nice touch.

Very clean and friendly. Would return again
author: Robert E.

description: This is hands down the worst sushi I've ever had in my life. I got it delivered so I expected some items to be cold. The potstickers were not only cold but had a really off-putting taste. The "real crab" in the California roll had the consistency of thick sand and tasted like the worst rotten fish I've ever tasted. Upon spitting it out, I smelled the roll and it smelled absolutely putrid. All of the other rolls i got also tasted extremely overly fishy, mushy, and old. The avocado in the rolls was dark black like it had been sitting out for an entire day. Everything I got was inedible. Even the miso soup tastes very off. Stay far far away from this restaurant.
author: Max K.

description:
WORST. Just simply WORST.
miso soup that looked like soup from new Ghostbusters movie!!! Though in a movie it was a joke - at this place it's for real. And "amazing" sushi with crab where amount of crab in each was like a droplet.
author: M. Z.

description: One of the worst places to eat. Absolutely nothing special about the food here. The worst offender was the soft shell crab - tasted like cardboard.
author: Eva C.

description:
My friend and I used to come here when they used to be "sushi rock"  maybe changed of ownership or something, they have changed their name twice; however, we still call it sushi rock or just rock to be short.  

Their menu definitely changed a little bit, but the taste still the same and they offered more items now.  My friend and I recently came here for lunch and noticed they serve "ramen".  MMmm gonna give this place a try and see if they are any good.  

I usually come here to get their bento box and its the best deal ever.  you get to have any 3 items and it comes with soup, salad, rice, and fruits on the side.  I have always changed around my combination depends on my mood, but I always get either teriyaki, katsu, and tempra.  Its a perfect portion, but if you are very hungry, you can get their signature roll along with the bento box, guarantee you will be full for sure. 

service: on point and always attentive.  They are very fast and bring any item you need right away. 

ambiance: very cozy and always play modern or sometimes oldies music.  TV are always on and it plays different channels each time.  

Location: locate close to Chinatown, if you are right by Chinatown, that's a perfect spot for you.  if you are working in the financial district, prepare to walk up the hill on Pine toward Grant.  It's a little steep, if you are not in shape, you will have a good work out before enjoying your meal.
author: Candice Y.

description: Great service, but the food (49er roll + tonkatsu) was uniformly disappointing.
author: Barack O.

description:
The sushi is good, but the hot food no so much.

The 4 stars is based on the sushi, since thats all I ever order here.
The hot food kitchen is closer to a 2.

They package and label the sushi nicely if you get it delivered.
author: David T.

description:
Our waiter was not friendly at all and it seems that a simple request was met with a troubled look.  The nigiri that was ordered looked good (presentation wise) but one of the pieces of fish was old and had to be spit out. The others pieces were decent at best. The decor was average but I did like the sushi bar set up.  One of the cooks, wearing a chef coat, was walking around opening doors with his gloves still on and went back into the kitchen still wearing the same gloves. 

 I was on the hunt for sushi on New Years Day and with a lot of other sushi restaurants being closed we took a chance on this three star Yelp rated restaurant and discovered on this day that there stars was one too many.
author: Roger Z.

description: Pretty much in line with the other reviews. 7pm and I was the only one there. Should have been a earing. Had my standard edamame and 10 pieces of nigiri sushi. Nothing special really. The sushi didn't taste particularly fresh. Mackerel seemed a bit off taste. But prices were great!
author: Wayne K.

description: We came by to grab a bite and decided to just grab a sake. They advertise they have HH but it is 25% off. They have no food happy either. Oh, half off hit and cold sake, house only. It is Ozeki which is the worst tasting sake ever. They heat it because it takes terrible. We paid our check and left. It looked dirty and was empty. Didn't want to take any chances.
author: Valerie M.

description: Ordered 2 of the sesame chicken with people I was with. One had very little chicken and a gallon of sauce. The other had a lot more chicken and was dry.  Service was slow and took to long to get check.
author: Joshua H.

description:
Delicious and fresh! 
Had the California Rolls and Japanese Curry.
Friendly, fast service.
author: Kirill R.

description:
My family & I wanted to spend the day in Chinatown &  try some authentic food. Minutes upon entering Chinatown they started complaining how hungry they were. So this restaurant is located just a few blocks inside the Chinatown arch. 

When we sat down I read the Yelp health warning & I thought we had made a big mistake & would be suffering from food poisoning in the upcoming days. It's been a few days & my family & I are all healthy. What issue they may have been having seems to have been fixed. When we sat down we were served hot miso soup which was a great way to warm up after the cold wind. The restaurant was very clean and the service not only fast but the servers were incredibly attentive. We had their signature sushi rolls along with a teriyaki chicken box. Everything was very delicious & the fish did taste fresh. Oh, and they have their own, very clean, restroom.
author: Lolita B.

description:
Came by this place for a lunch session, and it wasn't bad. As you walk up to the place, it's at the corner, and the door is on the side. Came here mid-day on a Sunday at approximately 2 PM and got seated pretty quickly. There was no wait, so there were no issues with that and got offered water on the get go. Ordered the bento box and it seemed to be pretty good with value for $15. Tried the Mango Spider Roll and liked the texture of the tobiko with the avocado. Thought the Mango was a little too sweet. Also had the Jay Roll and the hamachi was fresh and flavorful.

Other Notes: 
-Wings were pretty typical and just fried
-Gyoza was crisp

Overall:
Good Sushi. Appetizers are meh. Good value though.
author: Frank O.

description:
This is my favorite sushi place in San Fran!
The staff is not always the most attentive, but the food is excellent! 
The Godzilla roll is my favorite!
author: Tonja L.

description: It was decently sized and very nice and clean. I ordered a Godzilla roll and gyozas and they tasted wonderful. The wait time was about 10min so not to bad. I would recommend this place
author: Jonna S.

description: Great lunch specials and view of Chinatown. everything was delicious and our waitress was sweet and patient. we immediately felt welcome. don't miss this place! it's a gem
author: Sarah B.

description: Amazing service, food is fast and really delicious! Sweet and patient staff totally going to my favorites
author: Joe F.

description: Golden gate & Tokyo rolls were pretty good. Quick service. Parking is quite a challenge to find here.
author: Rose T.

description: Staying at the Ritz Carlton right around the corner and wanted some sushi! Great little spot that's close by! We ordered sashimi and a couple of rolls. The service was great and the restaurant was quiet. Servers super friendly!
author: Tabitha L.

description:
I've had my fair share of sushi and I can honestly say that I really like this place. Ordered via Grubhub and my order was ready on time, wrapped nicely, and even came with a generous amount of soy sauce.

Ordered the California Roll, Tokyo Roll, and the I.H. Roll. BF ordered the Snow Salmon Roll and the Golden Gate Roll. Everything was delicious except the Snow Salmon; tasted more like a tuna sandwich according to bf. 

We live fairly close to this place yet we always take it for granted. Not too many good sushi places in SF but I can honestly say this one ranks good on my top sushi places in the Bay Area.
author: Shela D.

description: This sushi is some of the best I've had. I got the chef special sashami and I'm completely blown away.
author: Angela B.

description: Its next to my new favorite hotel and near the entrance or Chinatown. There is also a Starbucks near by. The atmosphere is friendly and the servers are considerate. The decorations were interesting which kept me entertained as i waited for the food. The sushi chef was super cool, we didnt talk to him but he was just super cool to watch. Odd I know. I was also drinking sake from a wood cup. It was a great time and I'll head back soon. I gave it a 4 because it seemed rather tight and not very spacious for a restaurant but perfect as a bar.
author: Karina G.

description:
Ramen is by far the worst in the city, very strong stench of seaweed. Taste like a giant cup of salty seaweed that was absolutely disgusting. Personally love ramen and visited almost every spot in the city, definitely not coming back. 

Lets not forget we never got service. 15 min to place an order and we never saw her again after. Terrible terrible terrible
author: Max L.

description: Prompt delivery to my house. I ordered a shrimp tempura hand roll and gyoza. Gyoza was so delicious and warm when I received it. However the hand roll had old avocado slices. It was warm as of it has been sitting out and also brown. Disappointed. I couldn't eat it of course. Their menu appears great. I would be willing to try this restaurant again.
author: Chrishel D.

description:
I cannot believe it's taken me so long to find this place!! 

Had a hankering for sushi the other day but didn't want to stray too far from the office. I got so excited when Rock Japanese came up on Yelp. 

The service was fast and friendly, and the menu is extremely diverse. They also offer a lot of sake options, which can be hard to find with most of the super casual sushi places in the area.

We started with the edamame and the seaweed salad (both solid). I appreciated the free miso soup, which was also very tasty. We ordered the following rolls:

1. 49er roll
2. Philadelphia roll
3. Dynamite roll
4. Poki roll

All 4 rolls were super tasty, although the poki roll was my favorite. The fish tasted fresh and the rolls were generous sizes. A bit too much tobiko for my liking, but didn't affect the rolls. 

Very casual atmosphere, great for a quick lunch or an outing with a group of friends. Will definitely be back!
author: Regina L.

description: My boyfriend and I were skeptical about this place due to the rating, but we're glad we tried it anyway. We just finished our Ubereats order with two bento boxes and they were delicious ! Food was hot and fresh, tempura delicious and crispy, teriyaki beef was light and yummy, katsu was bomb, and we loved the salad dressing. Would order again for bento boxes, but haven't tried the sushi.
author: Lilly M.

description:
Well so my friend lives near here and I have to say SUPER impressed.  The sushi was awesome. The staff was overly friendly. 

I got the Lion King and it was surreal. 

The place is also unique in the fact that it is on a hill with Windows that give u the feeling you're defying gravity. 

If you're near the Ritz and want good sushi, come here...
author: eli o.

description:
I'm surprised at the low ratings for this place. I had a great dinner and wonderful experience here! 

Food:
-Tuna Tataki: this appetizer was really tasty. The fish tasted fresh and I enjoyed the light, but flavorful sauce served with it. A great starter. 

-Salmon Snow Roll: this roll was so yummy! The scallops had great taste and texture. Not much of a salmon flavor, as the name might imply, but the overall roll was quite enjoyable. 

Ambiance: When we first walked in, there was a bit of a damp smell that concerned me. However, it eventually dissipated. The restaurant was clean and we were sat in the corner where the 2 large windows meet. The view was great! 

Service: This, in combination with the food, is why I rate this place with 5 stars. The servers were so kind, polite, and prompt. We also loved the miso soup at the beginning of our meal and the scoop of ice cream at the end. Our drinks were refreshed and they had a smile on their face each time they came by. Impeccable!
author: Susan G.

description:
Came here during the lunch hour and did not leave disappointed. The miso soup was fine yet I found it odd that my server didn't give me a spoon or scoop to consume it with at first. Located in the heart of Chinatown, Sushi Rock had an assortment of lunch specials as well as reasonable prices on sushi. I choose a 12-piece California roll as well as a four pieces of Tekka and an additional four pieces of Kappa. For some reason, I found that the California roll wasn't tightly wrapped as I am used to. No matter- I was just hungry, so I didn't hold it against Sushi Rock.

My wife had the lunchbox special, which I thought was the best deal for the $$$. I think it was between $8-10, yet the food assortment was sufficient and varied even for the first time visitor. I didn't notice that there was any sushi within the lunchbox special, yet that didn't seem to matter for my wife. I noticed that it had chicken, rice, and something else besides the miso soup and seaweed that was served prior to the arrival of the entree.

Overall, very reasonably priced ($22 for lunch) and easy to get to. Certainly on my list to return to.
author: Eric T.

description:
We chose this place for lunch to satisfy our craving for sushi while working in nearby FiDi. Overall it was a great lunch experience. 

We arrived around 11:30 am and we were 2 of only 2 tables! The host seated us right away and, as expected, the server took our drink orders immediately. 

The lunch menu has a myriad of options. Diners can order off the tradition sushi and entree menu as well as the rather extensive lunch menu containing bowls and bento boxes. We decided to split 2 rolls and a side of edamame.

Each diner is created with soup and seaweed salad for staters. The sweet 16 roll and rock n roll were great and they came out quickly. The edamame was cooked to perfection and not too salty. 2 rolls and a side were enough to fill us both. 

I will be back! Next time I would like to try a bento box-- the table next to us ordered them and they look tasty. 

By 12:30pm the lunch rush really picked up. I'm glad we came when we did!
author: Andrea H.

description:
I don't understand why this place is so underrated. I would literally go back here. I was around the area to try Mikaku, but since they weren't open yet, I went here instead. Service is very accommodating, they give complimentary miso soup, green tea and water. Atmosphere was simple, clean, and well lit. The serving time was on point! And the serving size is worth what I paid for. I had the Firecracker rolls, which I would recommend. Their 'real' California rolls were alright. 'Real', because they use actual snow crab instead of the imitation crab meat. I also had some tuna sashimi, which was alright. I had some Sapporo on the side too which cost me $1.75 cause it was still happy hour. And to top it off, they offered (este it was free) dessert (green tea ice cream), which was the cherry on top. Overall, I spent approx $30 for everything. 

Most of the time people come in for take out, but a lot of people come to dine after working hours.
author: Andie H.

description:
A great sushi spot. Fresh fish always. Simon is an amazing chef that rally care, I will definitely go back 
No alcohol yet.. :(
author: Keri A.

description:
Came here for their happy hour (1530-1830).

Parking is available on the street.  There is also 1h free parking (validated) in a nearby lot.

The dining area is quite large, and the fact that the restaurant on the 2F on a hill means the view is actually quite decent.

Special mention is the $1 sake bottles during Happy Hour.  Forget the $2 beers they also serve here.  It's cheaper to get messed here than in Vietnam.  I was giggling the whole time.  For the beers, it's buy 2, get 1 for 1c more.

The chicken karaage was fresh and delicious, but a bit pricey at $6.25 it was a tad on the expensive.  Buy more sakes and offset your costs.

Next time I'm in San Fran, I'm definitely making a stop here.  Before 1830, of course.
author: Edward L.

description: Best sushi I ever had delivered. I ordered the mango tuna roll and the 49er roll. Excellent.
author: Justine P.

description:
The food is great here. Large portions of quality sashimi. I couldn't believe the portion size. I had the added benefit of having a light eater with me so I got to finish theirs too! The place is
Comfortable and they treat everyone like family.
author: Nacho R.

description:
This place has good deals and nice lunch specials but the quality is absolutely.. almost to the point of unbearable. 

Sushi is not fresh, tastes stale, miso soup is sooooo salty, and all the items in the bento are really small/thin/shriveled and probably came out from the freezer and got fried up. I would not recommend this place but if you're looking for a quick, clean, and cheap place and don't mind having non authentic Japanese food, then go here!
author: Jessica L.

description:
This place was close to our home and we were looking for a quick sushi place so we stopped by, my husband and I are from Japan and had quite high standards but they served us a meal fully equipped with miso soup and was very close to what we were used to at home. The meal was great and the service was usual for an asian restaurant. It wasn't anything over the top, or special, but it was a great fix for our home sickness. Also, there is A TON of choices! Which is great! (Even for vegetarians) 

They're fish is safe and they're dishes are very similar to what you would get at any Japanese restaurant, we both enjoyed being able to have a nostalgic meal away from home. 

They also do delivery which is awesome! But the food quality drastically drops, so beware! 

Nice service, quick and efficient, not very talkative. Great if you're used to eating out in asia. 

Cheers!
author: Alisa K.

description: 5 stars for the service. Waiter offered to split the check for everyone in a large group from the office. That's great service. Food hasn't arrived yet.
author: Jackson S.

description:
Lunch time and there were about 4 tables of people.  Staff is super attentive and the place is large, airy and clean.  TV's around the place (showing the olympics-yay) Huge windows that over look the streets so people watching is great... especially the tourist and the tourist trying to parallel park in front... its fasinating! 

I ordered gyoza - really tasty, served super hot and had the yummy crispy edges (my fave part).  Inari-just tofu and rice sushi, can't mess that up!  Then I also ordered a roll.  Tempura Shirmp and Unagi - it was good, but thinner than I am accustom to.  My bill came out to $21!  Kinda pricey if  you ask me!!  

Its good but pricey.  Don't think I'd be back, unless I order a bento box or Happy Box special - those are about $9.  But service is great.
author: Erika G.

description: 1st time in the Chinatown of San Francisco as an adult and we really wanted sushi. This was a short walk from where we parked and it wasn't too busy. We really enjoyed the poke salad & rainbow roll. Would've like to have room for fried bananas or their authentic cheesecake! There's always next time!
author: Daisy G.

description: This was the first and last time ordering food here. My boyfriend had the chicken Katsu and it was burnt/dry and they barely gave you any for the price. The salmon sashimi was fishy and the Salmon snow roll was disgustingly fishy! Super disappointed.
author: Breannah r.

description:
The food is alright. It reflects how much it cost. Lunch box $8.95 

The waitress is mute, if she's not mute then she chooses to communicate only through nodding and split second long smiles so do not go into this restaurant in hopes of getting normal human interaction. 

Location is pretty decent. No wait line during lunch hour.
author: Evelyn W.

description: I've been reluctant to try ordering food from here based upon the 3 stars rating but finally read some recent reviews and figured that I'd give it a chance. The fish tasted fresh and there was a generous portion included with each item. I'll definitely be ordering from here again.
author: Adam S.

description:
I was in the area to eat at Mikaku but they weren't open for dinner service yet. Going against the yelp consumer alert, we decided to stop in Rock Japanese Cuisine. This place is severely under rated. The staff was extremely friendly, accommodating, and helpful, and the prices were good. Happy Hour brings 25% off appetizers!

When we first sat down we were given waters and miso soups on the house. We ordered Edamame, Gyoza, a Rock Box Special, Philadelphia Roll, and an I.H Roll. We paid about $45 for everything. To end, they gave us some green tea and pina colada ice cream. 

If there was an issue with this place in the past, it's not apparent now. The atmosphere is great, the staff is friendly, and the prices are amazing.
author: Adrian P.

description: Delicious fresh sushi beautifully prepared! The service was fast and very friendly. Solid sushi spot in Chinatown. Ask for a seat by the big windows and enjoy the people watching!
author: Don S.

description: I have been going to the Rock for a very long time (20+ years?) and some of the same waiters are still there. I try to go during lunch time because you can get a bentobox meal for under $10. You can choose any 3 of 12 items in your bentobox meal. I usually get gyoza, tempura and chicken katsu. Parking at lunch isn't too bad, though I usually park my scooter at the front door when it's not raining without trouble. Fast, tasty and good service; what more could you want for that price?
author: Tim M.

description:
My rating is reflecting my opinion on the food, which I thought was good. I got the bento box (teriyaki salmon, kastu chicken and cucumber rolls) and some mochi (mango and strawberry) for dessert. Totally affordable.

HOWEVER, if I had to rate the service ONLY...oh boy...The first waitress, who took our (my parents and I) order, was nice. But then, another waitress stepped in and wow, killjoy. First, she seemed pretty annoyed when I asked for dessert when she brought the bill. Sorry, I didn't know it was such a pain in the a** to add an item on the bill. Also, lucky her, I knew what I wanted so she didn't have to bring me the menu. At the end, we wanted to pay by card. While she was away minding her business, I told my parents that I really did not want to give her tips because of her behavior. Instead of not giving tips, we decided to pay a round sum. Then, she came back and told us the card was denied. Alright, that's fine. We paid by cash. And when we thought we were done, she pointed on the bill the suggested tips. Like...she was forcing us to give her tips. Like...who the f*** does that? My mom ended up doing a petty move and poured all of her coins from her purse on the table. That was brilliant.

Now, I know it's Christmas. I can understand working on Christmas is awful. But why do you have to be rude to people who came to your restaurant to enjoy a meal and who did nothing to you? Why do you think it is ok to behave this way? If it happened in my dear lovely home country France, I would not mind at all because tips is not part of our culture. But here, in the US, I heard that's something quite serious. So please, next time, if you feel like you are going to be rude to customers, just sit in a corner of the restaurant and think about why you should probably get a new job. Who knows.

MERRY CHRISTMAS, KISS MY A**
author: Karen R.

description:
I thought this place was decently priced for what you get and is my new favorite sushi place in this neighborhood. There was lots of variety (rolls, udon, donburi, sashimi, nigiri, soba to name some) and enjoyed the hot green tea and miso soup that were included with all the dishes. 
I also really enjoyed the large windows with a view of Pine st. and Grant ave. My server was alright, there was another server who seemed much friendlier. But everything was done in a reasonable, timely manner. 
I went for lunch and ordered the ikura and uni donburi for $20.95. I enjoyed it a lot. It was pretty fresh and filled me up. 4/5 stars because it's not the ultimate best sushi I've had but near the top of the list, especially for the price. I would definitely come back here to satisfy an uni or sashimi craving if I'm in the area and will try out their dinner and happy hour. 
The happy lunch box was also a good, tasty deal. You get 3 things listed for $9.95. Other places charge a lot more for the same or less items.
author: Kat C.

description: Whenever you're in China Town, make sure you stop by this restaurant. It won't disappoint! Affordable price with great food!! I'm glad I stumbled upon this place.
author: Newheart R.

description:
I think this has got to be the worst sushi place ive ever been to. I suggest not coming here if you're starving or if you don't mind waiting 40 MINUTES for your food to come out. 

My boyfriend and I came here with his friend and his girlfriend. We were seated right away and drinks were brought out almost immediately. We ordered our rolls and like I stated, waited way too long to receive even 1. They all arrived staggered and in 10 minute intervals. We didn't get to eat together and basically lost our appetite since we waited too long and watched as we all individually ate our own rolls at different times. The service was just horrible and when we brought up the issue, we were acknowledged but later brushed off and forgotten. 

They definitely didn't get a tip and I definitely won't be coming here again.
author: Karla E.

description:
Three of us were in town for a conference and we were looking for sushi restaurants that were walking distance from our hotel. We came across this place by accident, and we were pleasantly delighted by the quality of the food and courteousness of the staff. Out waitress was amazing (I wish we had asked for her name). I was in the mood for Unagi and she gave great recommendations. 
All of the rolls we tried were delicious! And the meal comes with complementary miso soup and ends with complimentary ice cream! We returned the next day for dinner because we thoroughly enjoyed our meal  and the staff were so friendly and efficient! Our waitress also remembered our preferred ice cream flavor!
author: Samannaaz K.

description:
Came here because the happy hour looked like a good deal, and because it's just a minute away from where I work. Oh, and because I love sushi, but...duh.

HH prices were excellent. Service was fast and friendly. When my roll was taking a little longer than the other dishes my group had ordered, the waitress came to tell me why, and it came shortly after.

I had the Momo roll--not because I knew what it was or liked the ingredients, but because I have a cat who we call Momo (and no, not because I wanted to believe he was IN the roll). It was delicious! Sushi Rock might not be the freshest sushi place out there, but it was great for what it was and I'd definitely come again!
author: Katie V.

description:
While visiting San Francisco in May we decided to give Sushi Rock a try because hubby had a Goggle offer for buy one meal get one free.  We went in early Friday evening and it was busy.  We were seated by the window.  I have simple tastes so I ordered the Rock Box special with shrimp tempura, vegetable tempura and a California roll, hubby had the Rock Box special also but with sea bass, California roll and shrimp tempura.  The food was actually very good, the only complaint is the miso soup was so salty that I could barely finish it.  

We showed them the Goggle offer which was accepted with no problem at all.  The service was good.

For what it was, it was a very good deal!
author: Vikki J.

description:
A solid sushi spot. 

They have a good selection of food, and especially for Japanese  restaurants, I tend to go for places with a large selection/variety of sushi rolls (though nowadays I don't mind trying places with smaller selections if it is more authentic Japanese cuisine- anyways, I digress..). The service is very pleasant and attentive- the boyfriend and I have eaten here numerous times, and it is nice that the owner recognizes us- it gives off a very friendly and warm vibe. Also, it has a pretty large seating area, we never have to  wait to be seated, and I like how much natural lighting there is because of the large windows. 

In terms of the food, I usually get their:
- Phoenix Roll (shrimp tempura, avocado, eel, imitation crab) yummy!
- Dragon roll (classic- can't go wrong with a dragon roll- or the catepillar roll
- Salmon Sashimi (large pieces, and it's fresh! buttery and melts in my mouth)

There are also other interesting rolls like one with mango in it, and some wrapped in soy paper, etc.

BF gets the:
- Udon, or bento box with beef teriyaki, or curry - all of which he likes, but I prefer sushi rolls

Overall, I'd say this place is in a convenient location, has good sushi, and great service. The prices are not cheap- but this is pretty typical for a sushi place.
author: Kathleen Y.

description:
Despite the basic interior, the food was fresh and delicious. 
We ordered to go 4 different specialty rolls ( mango and tuna , jay roll , B52 roll and the cherry blossom roll ). A really pleasant surprise!
author: Chloe J.

description:
Delicious food. Absolutely fantastic. The seaweed salad and boiled spinach dishes are both dressed perfectly! The both are citrus-y and have a great zing while the seaweed has an almost nutty quality.

The sashimi plater was incredible. Very fresh and delicately sliced. The ginger complimented it beautifully. The star of the meal, however, was defiantly the seaweed and spinach. 

The servers were kind and very enthusiastic and the interior was neat and comfortable. Bathrooms a little grungy but that was barley noticeable as compared with all the pluses. Overall simply beautiful.
author: Rey J.

description:
I had lunch Thursday, July 17th and ended up with a severe case of FOOD POISONING--- I'm still dealing with the effects 4 days later... I ordered the rainbow roll, tuna handroll, tako sunomono, salmon nigiri, and miso.  

I never give horrible recommendations, but this place needs to be inspected by the health dept ASAP
author: Angela E.

description:
I've been here a couple times because I'm always craving sushi and this place is conveniently located near the front of Chinatown (pretty close to the temple looking gates on Grant). 

Their sushi isn't the greatest, but it's not terrible either. I've had several of their special rolls and tried their dinner box (avocado roll, California roll, Saba shioyaki -my all time favorite fish). The rolls hadn't bit too much rice and didn't taste special, but the service here is great and the waiters are all very nice and fast with your order.
author: Jeanette S.

description:
In my opinion, this is a decent 4 star eatery. Staff were extremely attentive, no wait time for anything. Menu is quite big with plenty of options. Food was good, but not great and hence 4 stars.

The location is pretty good and there is always a table or two available.
author: Piotr G.

description: Nice sushi joint. Fish is super fresh and the service is impeccable.. They also have an awesome happy hour between 3:30-6:30. We'll definitely be back !
author: Faud H.

description: Very yummy. The rolls (shrimp tempura and spicy scallop) do not have a thick layer of rice but more of the good insides. Seaweed salad was fresh.
author: Kathy N.

description:
The sushi and miso soup was good, above average but not phenomenal. I will definitely be coming back for more though. Good prices. 

However, the waitress rushed us when the restraunt was not crowded or near closing hours. As soon as I picked my last roll off the plate...my plate was gone! Only negative aspect but I will definitely be back!
author: Doug P.

description: I'm really surprised to see low ratings of this restaurant! It is amazingly delicious and the attention is GREAT! Our server, Lidia is just the sweetest person, willing to help us with every question we had! The Price is great as well, nice portions and reasonable price! Just LOVED this place!!!
author: Jonathan Q.

description:
I came here for a (really) quick dinner before going to see Roxette at the Masonic (don't be jealous).  We asked how quick service would be before we were seated, because we didn't want to set them up for failure.  They assured us we were be fine, and seated us at the bar.  

Miso soup and seaweed salad upon being seated, which were both really good.  We each ordered one roll, which was served within a few minutes, as promised.  The staff were very attentive, and definitely helped us get to our show on time!  They knew we were in a hurry and were prompt with the check.  We were putting out coats back on when they surprised us with scoops of ice cream in to go cups!  This was super awesome.  The free soup and seaweed are pretty standard in sushi restaurants, but this was new for me.  And they definitely could have skipped it for us since we were obviously ready to blaze out, so bonus points for them making the effort so we could take it with us.

I'm only giving 4 stars because I only had a California roll, so I don't really feel like I can give a full review.  The service won me over though, so I would love to come back to try a few more items and update my review.  

As a note -- I didn't think they were expensive at all.  We got out for just $20 with tip, although we only had one roll each and drank water.  I suppose it's all about the experience you're looking for.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Calee S.

description:
I have yet to try their happy hour, which runs until 6:30pm. I hear there's $4 cocktails and rolls. 

Right when you get seated, you get free miso soup and pickled cucumber and seaweed. They also end you meal with a half scoop of green tea ice cream. A nice touch I'd say.

I ordered the Kitsune Udon, which is chicken and vegetable with udon. The chicken had an interesting flavor to it -- as if it was not a good cut or not marinated long enough. Other than that, the dish was fine. I prefer the udon noodle soup at Tokyo Express though (better flavored chicken)!
author: Audrey L.

description:
Is it just me or did this place used to have a different name?  Well, who knows... but I think it did.  I think last time I came here it was sushi, but a different name.

Anyways, went here and had the seafood donburi and it was awesome.  I highly suggest!  Also had some saki and the poki handroll and they were delish.  5 stars (why not?) it was yummy.  TV screen had a big black spot on it, lol.  

Japanese food in Chinatown?  Sure, why not?
author: Cynthia B.

description:
The ABSOLUTE WORST SERVICE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED IN San Francisco. The only thing that was good about this place was the Miso Soup. Salt is a cheap way to my heart.

This is the 2nd time I have ended up at this restaurant. The service was worse than my first experience. I like to give people a chance.  The male waiter though!?!?!? OMG what a d##k!!! Both times! He is rude and has no attention for detail. Screwed up the order and it took 30 minutes for me to get my correct meal. The ONLY thing we got a lot of was the cloudy tap water they kept bringing to the table.

We were also "helped" by a waitress. Jesus! How can anyone be that rude to their guests!? 

I literally HATE this place and if it had the only morsel of food left on our dying planet, I would gladly starve to death before I returned.

Hope you like the mediocre food, iceberg lettuce salad and bland chicken smothered in a nasty "teriyaki" sauce.
author: Themane D.

description:
First, the miso soup was incredibly salty, I had to add water to it. Not a huge burden, but miso soup is lovely to have on a cold, rainy day when it's made correctly. (I know how to make it since I'm actually Japanese)

The Caterpillar and Dragon I received were good in taste, however they were slightly falling apart...so poor execution. And I had lots of skin from the unagi instead of meat. 

The staff was so incredibly friendly, their service is what bumped my score from a 3-star to a 4-star review. Kindness is one of the best qualities in food service.

^^^ I wrote that before I asked for Green Tea Cheescake....I requested that it not be fried....to which they responded by giving me two sad pieces of FROZEN cheesecake. I get it, they keep it frozen so when they tempura fry it, it will then come out soft and all that. But not everyone wants fried Cheescake. Sitting there, waiting for the sad little pieces to defrost was a little depressing. This bringing my original 4-star and plummeting it to 2-star. I can't overlook this. I will try to come again one day and hopefully write a better review. Good luck, please take into consideration the review.
author: Lisa Y.

description: Oysters, sushi, and  green tea cheesecake!!!!! Delicious!!!! Fast service with a smile!!!!! It's a gem of a find....a little hole in the wall on the edge of Chinatown....the Jay roll is so delicious with melt in your mouth hamachi! The mikimoto oysters were fresh and sweet. You really can't go wrong!!!
author: Michelle M.

description:
Sushi Rock Rocks!  

It was our very first stop when we visited San Francisco for the first time.  I don't know if it was so good to us after we had two layovers and a long taxi ride, but it was absolutely delicious!  

We ordered the Edamame, Soft Shell Crab and Miso Soup for starters.  Yum! I had never eaten Miso soup without utensils, but it was a fun experience and cause for good picture moments (see photos).   For entrees, we had the Jim's Roll and the Checkboard Roll.  The Jim's Roll is made with Tuna, Shitake, Tobiko and Onion while the Checkerboard Roll is made with Crab, Tuna and topped with Hamachi. Both washed down with Nigori Unfiltered Sake and were equally tasty.  

The service was friendly and I loved the location and atmosphere.  I feel a tradition coming on for Sushi Rock being our first stop every time we visit San Fran.
author: Leslie P.

description:
This is a review of delivery from the Chinatown Sushi Rock.

It is easy to order via Grubhub.com.

Delivery - The order was placed at 7:23 PM.    The order was delivered at 7:58 PM.  Delivery time of 35 minutes.  Which I consider to be very quick.  There was no delivery charge.  The delivery person was professional and polite.

Minimum Order - Relatively High ($20)

Chicken Teriyaki Donburi - This was not a chicken teriyaki don.  It was simply teriyaki chicken served over rice with a small side salad and miso soup.  It was a very plain dish.  It was not what I expected for a donburi.  It was also cold when it was delivered.  This was surprising because the restaurant is only a few blocks away.

http://tinyurl.com/3oee57m

Mixed Tempura - This was pretty good.  Unlike the teriyaki, it was not cold.  Plus, it had maintained much of its crispness.

http://tinyurl.com/3mfyb8t

Miso Soup and Side Salads - These were both very basic.  I love miso soup but this was a very average rendition.  The salad was just some iceberg lettuce with some dressing.

Beverages - I ordered two beverages (Sprite and Cranberry juice) - These were delivered stored in plastic containers with ice.  This was a very different way to deliver beverages.  There were no spills.  But the portions were very small for each beverage.

Packing - The food was packed relatively neatly in plastic containers.

Prices - For me, the prices were a little high for what the quality of food.

1  Chicken Teriyaki Donburi  $ 7.50
1  Tempura  $ 9.25
1  Soda  $ 1.50
1  Juice  $ 2.50
Subtotal  $20.75
Tax  $1.76
Total  $22.51

Overall - For the most part, this was blah food.  It did not meet my expectations.  The teriyaki dish was not even the right dish or at least not prepared the way I am used to see donburi prepared.  The delivery was fast and friendly.  I thought the prices were slightly high (but not exorbitant).
author: Mark D.

description: Fantastic! I ordered the unagi rice bowl. It was perfect! My husband ordered curried beef he was pleased! California rolls were better than expected. The kids loved them! I was so surprised when we were brought out complimentary soup and seaweed salad. Even a bowl for the baby! We were also brought complimentary orange slices for each of my kids! I am not sure if that's customary for Japanese restaurants but it made my picky kids very happy! Only downsides: it was really warm in there! Smelled super fishy. (I know its to be expected but I wanted to toss it in there.) The bathrooms were not the best or cleanest. But we passed the kitchen and the kitchen looked really nice and clean! The view was awesome! I would definitly go back! Great friendly service and good food! Our bill was 32.00 for a california roll, unagi rice bowl, and cury beef.
author: Shuree G.

description: This place was amazing.  We had their oysters, a mixed nigiri plate, the butter poki roll, and the tempura bananas.  The oysters were really good, had a nice little spice added on top.  Both the nigiri and rolls were incredible, the fish tasted extremely fresh and the cuts were very thick.  The service was really good and it was pretty reasonably priced.  We will definitely be going back.
author: Brian K.

description: Nice and big, traditional japanese. Overlooks the street. The service was good. It took a while to get our food though. It took about 25 minutes for our app to show up, and then immediately after our entrees showed up. They were delicious. I ordered the chirashi and it was amazing.
author: Erik K.

description: Here in town for a few days and found this place on restaurants.com.  Staff was very nice and attentive. Tried a little of everything and it was great. The deep fried soft shell crab was amazing!! Tried a couple rolls and was all very fresh. Definitely worth trying!!
author: Jay A.

description: This is our go-to sushi spot when me and the roomies want delivery. Although a deep fried california roll sounds bland and boring- this one is delishhhh. Love that they have decent prices and they don't skimp you on food. The people that take our order are super nice and always remember us, although I guess that could be a bad thing...
author: Jordan S.

description: It was a busy night  in the City and the staff did their best to accommodate our large group.  We had to remind them of a few things they forgot to bring to our table but they compensated by giving us complimentary Miso Soup and Ice Cream scoops for our two families.  I'd have to say the MoMo Roll was a great roll to have since I could really taste the fatty tuna flavor.
author: Anthony E.

description: My boyfriend and our friends were craving sushi as soon as we arrived in SF. The first sushi place I thought of closest to the hotel we were staying at was this place. The first time I was here was in 2008 and had a fun experience. This past Friday was my second visit and my experience was very similar to my first. I wanted the Banzai Bunny sake and the waitress said they were all out of it, but she said she would double check for me. A couple mins later, she came out with the last one until their next shipment arrived. She also made some recommendations for my boyfriend and our friends since it was their first time here. The little time our waitress took to help make our visit enjoyable was greatly appreciated.
author: Christine R.

description: Great sushi and very reasonably priced!! I come here on a regular basis and have always received impeccable service and food delivered in a timely fashion. On top of that, they typically include complimentary ice cream with every meal. I would highly recommend!!
author: Sara H.

description: Awesome grinds!! Some of the freshest best Sushi we've ever had, great service, clean atmosphere, fried green tea cheesecake was off the hook!
author: Darrin F.

description:
The cleanliness is questionable....  The bottom of my sake glass had some weird goo.

There was nothing impressive about the food.  It was tasty but left me still hungry.
author: Heather W.

description:
I've ordered delivery from here multiple times and the food was always "okay" nothing write home about but nothing to complain about either.

I just ordered delivery again this evening and the fish was down right bad.  Like it's been sitting out for days.  Couldn't eat a single piece of the Pine Street combo.  Sadly won't order from here again.
author: Shannon J.

description: The rating we give is misleading.  The food would be five stars.  Really.  We had miso soup and some sushi rolls. VERY fresh and flavorful.  The sushi chef gets five stars.  The service, one star - unless there is a way to give a zero.  No smiles.  We felt as if we were imposing on them and we were one of two tables for lunch at first.   Even when we asked for drink refills, we didn't them. While we were there, 4-5 more diners were set.  The table next to us had two small children.  So they asked for forks for them to eat with. The "manager" turned away from them abruptly and rolled his eyes.  He was facing us so we got to see him.  Lovely.  That was typical of the service from him and our waitress.  If you go, get takeout.  We feel bad for the chef.  He should find a new place to shine.
author: Larry S.

description:
Almost came here once but then thought I should try Chinese http://www.yelp.com/biz/cathay-house-san-francisco, being in Chinatown and all, which turned out tasting like crap. So then I stumbled across this spot again and decided to give it a go.

Great spot for watching the throngs of tourists go by as it is situated on an upper level with lots of windows. Not exactly authentic Japanese, but it is a-ok. 

The first plate of cucumber/wakame salad was not vinegary or salty enough. Nice that it is complimentary though.

I had the larger tempura ($12.25) for dinner which you can also get in a smaller size. I think for the extra $2, you get an extra 1/3 of food. I say it's worth it. Everything was in multiples of threes: three prawns, three onion rings, three eggplants, three sweet potatoes, three zucchini pieces. You do get miso soup and rice as well. My only beef with it was that it was too crispy. Like painful crispy. Like this-hurts-my-gums-to-bite-into-this crispy. I think maybe they used too much flour in the tempura batter? 

Liked the cast iron teapots you get at your table. They also serve up genmai cha which is always nice on a cold blustery San Francisco evening. 

Since I don't have the luxury of having a Yelp app on my phone, I would probably come here again instead of taking a gamble. Life is too short for bad dining.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
If you're in SF and staying quite close to Chinatown, then the location of this spot is hard to beat. We stumbled upon this place in a hungry and thigh-burnt daze after walking up all those hills, but if I wasn't so hangry... I'm not quite sure this place would have been my first choice. 

The place is quite clean. The seating is just average and there are tv's for your viewing pleasure (they were playing pre-season football games so +1). The food was quite meh, except for one this which was horrid, and another thing which was absolutely delicious. The service is pretty bad (sorry). All but one waiter couldn't speak English which just made everything so much harder. 

Here's my rundown on the food:
Miso soup: pretty standard
Seaweed salad: awesome! had some cucumber in the mix too, which made it light and fresh
Sexy roll: I was quite confused when this arrived at my table and I was absolutely horrified when I tried it. It is described as "Imitations crab roll top with fresh salmon lightly baked with cheese" I MISINTERPRETED the "lightly baked cheese" as being cream cheese (as you would find in other sushi rolls), but I was shocked to see that it was a Kraft single. Look, I love Kraft singles just as much as the next guy, when it's melted in between two pieces of bread because it was a staple of my childhood, but there's a huge flavor difference between melted Kraft singles and non-melted/cold Kraft singles. Needless to say, the cheese was not melted so I peeled it off and proceeded to eat my imitation crab roll with salmon on top. It was delicious.
Daegi roll: Pretty good. Just the right amount of spice and the fish tasted fairly fresh.
49ers: Also pretty good.
Broiled squid: SO GOOD. Best part of my meal- hands down. The squid was tender. It was not overcooked, and it had a great flavor to it. I wish I just ate like 4 of these as my meal. It was delicious. If there's one thing this place knows how to do right, it's the broiled squid.

I found this place to be a bit pricey for the very underwhelming food that we received, but I felt that the squid was just amazing. Will I come back? Maybe, if I want to avoid all the places in SF with a crazy line up outside, but maybe not. Might come back for the squid though.
author: Leanne M.

description:
Friendly service and good sushi.  I ordered the chef's sashimi platter, which was beautifully arranged in a martini glass.  Fish was fresh.

Certainly not fancy like its down the street neighbor, Akiko Restaurant, but much more reasonably priced and easy to get into.
author: Sona P.

description:
This if for the lunch menu:

3 items + rice + miso Soup for $7.95

Yummy                        CHECK
Lots of food                CHECK
bang for your buck    CHECK
Quick service              CHECK

Me stuffing my face during lunch hour PRICELESS

Great deal- highly recommend! :-)
author: Achraf S.

description: This place is way better than its 3-star rating deserves.  We got complementary miso soup and seaweed salad to start and they we're delicious. Also, the $1.95 fresh oysters w roe on top we're an awesome suggestion from the waitress. Sushi is creative and delicious.  Not sure why other ppl had bad experiences - ours was great on a Friday night.
author: Yifan Z.

description:
I went here for dinner because they have a happy hour. During their happy hour I got a cheaper sake and half off appetizer. I ordered the tempura string beans and of course sake with two veggie rolls. I sat at the bar where you can watch them make the sushi which was cool and they did not stare at me cause I was eating by myself which is always nice. The guys making my sushi delivered quickly but the waitress forgot about my app and I had to reask for it. When it did come it was good. But the best part was the sushi and the sake. 

A good place to sit at the bar and just eat some sushi. They have TV's over the bar to stare at while you are eating by yourself. I will defiantly go here again. but only during Happy hour.
author: Cris F.

description:
I went here for the first time with my gf because we had a restaurant.com voucher.  I don't eat sushi super often, but was excited to see how this place would turn out.  Overall, it was a pretty good experience.  It's not super fancy, but you sort of get what you pay for.

We arrived later in the evening and were seated right away. Much to our dismay, there was a table of loud obnoxious drunks that made a ton of noise the whole time.  But I guess that's not uncommon in chinatown. As others have mentioned, we were were served miso soup and seaweed salad immediately.  Even if it isn't the greatest, it is free and quite enjoyable if you're already a little hungry.

Being vegans, our options were limited but the menu was huge.  We ended up getting a few different kinds of veggie rolls, some fried tofu bits, and fried potato things. The veggie rolls were all done fairly well, though my favorite were the kappa and avocado rolls. I thought the mixed veggie rolls didn't have enough of a distinct taste (including so many different chopped up radishes, peppers, and mushrooms).  Fried tofu is fried tofu, but the sauces that accompanied them were pretty tasty (one a teriyaki, the other I'm not sure what.) The fried potato appetizer almost reminded me of a samosa, as it was mashed potato with some peas in it. But instead of coming in a large fried dumpling shape it was flat and crispy.

The waiters and waitresses that attended to us were friendly and timely with their attention.  However, we ordered veggie tempura and they never brought over to us.  We're pretty sure another table got it by mistake, even though we were still charged. When we notified them of the mistake, they took it off our bill with no hassle (rightfully so.) They also served little scoops of ice cream at the end, but sadly, it was not the sort of ice cream we can partake of.  Perhaps, sushi rock, if you offered non-dairy ice creams at the end of the meal I might be inclined to give you an extra star...
author: Jon T.

description:
+3 stars for the Lunch visit, but the Dinner visit ruined it all.

Terrible staffing and subpar food quality.

Was anyone else out here for dinner on Sunday, FEBRUARY 19th, 2012?!?  Speak up, yo!

It was the most epic failing of a restaurant I had ever seen.  If you ever wonder why restaurant crew come together for a meeting before the start of a shift, it's probably to avoid abominations like these.

First.  We showed up around 8pm.  There were about 6 servers working-- one chef behind the sushi bar.  People look swamped.  Inexperienced.  PANICKING.  
Ok,  I get that it's the President's Day Weekend (minus a Bay Bridge), but really? You should think about staffing competent people for a long weekend.  We quickly blended in with the group of unaddressed people standing at the door.  Adequate staffing FAIL.

Second.  People look pissed.  Correction:  EVERYONE looks pissed.  What's going on?  The server starts bringing out our order but kept placing all the plates/bowls/appetizers on an EMPTY seat (we were a party of 3) and we had to re-route all the settings amongst us.  WTF?  Obviously this guy has no idea how to serve.  Competent staffing FAIL.

Third.  We quickly realize why people look pissed.  Orders weren't being placed in the right order.  We got our food before this couple who said loudly "Wait, they got their food??".  They had placed an order over 20 minutes ago.  The server straight up forgot.  And guess what?  There were a whole bunch of other tables without their food.  Some people walked out after complaining.  Serving FAIL.

The pandemonium is reaching its peak.  The restaurant is filled with sweet sweet bitterness.  One server turns on the stereo to drown out the sound of anger with some music.  GWEN STEFANI BLASTS THROUGH THE SPEAKERS.  The staff runs back.  He can't figure out how to lower the volume for nearly 10 seconds.  People look more pissed.  Vibe FAIL.

Decision:  They really need to scrub this place up with proper staffing-- and then I probably still wouldn't consider returning.  Having one overwhelmed sushi chef isn't going to take you anywhere.
author: Eugene L.

description:
Normally greeted with very nice workers. 
The always order the bento with chicken teriyaki, vegetable tempura, and california rolls. I felt like the sushi rolls were just too expensive to try.
The food is fairly decent. It has a nice environment for a couple friends to catch up. 
I came here so much that the owner remembered my face and offered me ice cream sometimes! Friendly people.

One time though, my friends were chased out because they didn't pay enough tip... gotta watch out for them new workers, they're fiesty!
author: Linda K.

description:
Outstanding value
Had to Post an update to say simply that while the cost has gone up on the lunch special, the quality of food and service have gone up as well. Our sashimi was the freshest tenderest fish I have ever eaten And while many restaurants offer only two basic choices for the bento box, Sushi Rock continues to offer three premium choices for under $10. 
Great progress under the new ownership.
author: Bryan O.

description:
I will be back..
Good sushi and prices but a little lacking on service. It's ok because I was at bar and that rocked. 
Good prices and quality sushi. I have had better with price equivalent but they were darn good.
author: Cherlyn E.

description: The service was good and the squid appetizer was yummy, the dipping sauce they served with it made it yummier. Their happy hour was good too, 25% off appetizers and 1/2 price drinks I believe? Good house sake and good location. Two of their walls are nothing but window which was also nice!
author: Samantha S.

description: Amazing sushi. Tempura sushi and California in particular were great. And the fried stars were absolutely yummy! Loved that.
author: Namira B.

description: Super delicious, affordable and excellent service. In addition, I love the fact that they accept restaurant.com gift certificates
author: Mike L.

description:
Sushi Rock is not a bad place, but it showed me something I guess I have lived long enough to see. This place looks like something that used to be popular. It's like an empty disco roller rink in 1992.

You could look at the place and see its former awesomeness. But dude, it was 6om and I was the only person in the joint. 40 empty tables. 

Yeah. It was good sushi. But in San Francisco that's not saying anything special. Sushi Rock is a has been.
author: Michael B.

description: Reasonable prices, decent food.  Almost passed it over because of the weird chemical smell in the entry way.
author: J D.

description: Great service at this place! They were so thoughtful- split the bill individually by default without us even asking, and gave us free ice cream each too!
author: Thavidu R.

description:
ordered delivery via yelp. very fast and orderly but the sushi wasn't great :( I can't describe it but it quickly became bland and boring. 

Maybe they don't mix seasoned vinegar for their sushi rice, or if they do, they should use a little more. vinegar rice makes a huge difference.
author: Yuki A.

description:
Once I walked into the restaurant,. it smelled like strong soy sauce,. spilled soy sauce on furniture that have not been cleaned up.  

They had happy hour until 6:30 and it is only for selected appetizers/drinks and NOT THE SUSHI ROLLS,. 

The best happy hour appetizer was the bacon wrapped shrimp, we had two orders of those which was $4 for 6.  I stuck with my original spicy scallop handroll and had a duck roll which was unique.  It tasted like I was eating duck over rice. 

We ordered a bunch of sushi and sashimi,. and the super white tuna was cut too thick,. i was only able to eat one of the white tuna and passed on the rest. 

Not sure if I will come back,. but if I do,. it would be for the bacon wrapped shrimp and the complimentary sorbet ice cream at the end of the meal.

Also,. you will not get the %15 saving on your meal by stating you had found the restaurant through YELP.   You have to show them proof that you had text the number,. NO WAY JOSE! I am not about to get spammed,..
author: Chanel L.

description: Got Phenoix roll really good!! My husband got the teriyaki chicken and he loved it. I got the tofu teriyaki and I didn't really like it the tofu wasn't deep fired and it was very soft. Overall the place was good I suggest go for the sushi!
author: Ria D.

description:
Sushi Rock...didn't really rock my boat.  Ok sushi..i had one of those spicy tuna rolls.  I had a taste of their udon (not my order) and it tasted good. I also ordered their mackerel (it was supposed to be broiled) but end up looking like it's fried (just too oily) ..i know that saba(mackerel) is a fatty fish but I tried broiled mackerel before from another restaurant and it didn't give me a free lip gloss (if you know what I mean hehehe). 

The service was very good.  Ambience ok but I'm facing two lovebirds (young Asian female and an old Caucasian male) enjoying their sake and their Japanese beers (they ordered a lot).  She was drinking like a Sailor... Like that girl,I think I will have a lot of alcohol too =P ...LOL
author: Jing F.

description: I love the food, so yummy. And the waiter are so nice.   I will definitely come back again!
author: Icyrita Z.

description:
Came on a very hot day. 

They gave us complimentary miso soup, cucumber/seaweed and ice cream. 

We got a few rolls, the best was the scallops. Since it was so hot, or rice was room temperature, which was warmer than usual. 

There was one guy hosting/waitering. Good service.
author: Mandy D.

description:
Sushi Rock was a convenient sushi restaurant in China Town. The menu for lunch, bento box is very reasonably prices with many selections. 

I had the bento box with three items - chicken katsu, California rolls, and fry tofu.  The serving was just right; however, quality will need more work.  The chicken katsu was dry and crispy, California rolls fell apart.  the only items that have good quality is the fry tofu and the steam rice. 

I think Sushi "Rock" in their excellent service, but their food quality did not Rock that much.
author: Chucky L.

description: So, I think it's pretty obvious that you're not going to get top of the line sushi at Sushi Rock.  What you will get though is a reasonably priced combination set that allows you to taste a variety of things without needing to commit to any one item.  I've never had anything else here except for their combo set.  They come and serve you pretty quickly, giving you some tsukemono to snack on while you decide on what you want.  I don't know what their sashimi is like (probably wouldn't order it, to be completely honest) so I usually stick to cooked non-fish things (chicken katsu, gyoza, cucumber rolls, and shrimp tempura) for my combination box.  I wouldn't come here unless I absolutely had NO other options (Thai Spice is right by here, and has MUCH better food), which is how I've ended up at Sushi Rock on the few occasions.  Overall, just "meh".
author: Lisa I.

description:
There were a lot of mixed reviews on yelp about this place.

Service was by far the best service I think I've ever had.  I don't even know any many people waited on us but I don't even care.  We never had to wait on anything.

Food - Hardly had to wait.... maybe 5 minutes and the food was coming out.

Will revisit this place again in 2013... :-)
author: Casey H.

description:
Sushi quality is not bad, however, as a frequent customer (at least once a week delivery orders) I am sad to say that they have lacked in delivering orders in time. When placing a delivery order, I've been given 45min wait time, which im ok with. On number of occasions delivery took well over 1.5hr. Their reason for such long wait is due to orders being placed all at once - seems fishy (pun intended) since this has been their excuse each time they are well over the expected time.

I would NOT recommend this place as a delivery option.
author: Ruslan T.

description:
Thou shall not play Miley Cyrus at a sushi restaurant. Also, I'm sushinazi.yelp.com.. what kind of review did you expect??

Service was good, but definitely not the sushi. It was even bad for what I like to call "white people sushi" (no offense to the Caucasians reading this, but come on... you know what I'm talkin about!). TT Roll was just some really oddly-colored tuna (it was ROSY pink.. not red), fried on the outside, and topped with a slight dab of sriracha sauce. What the hell is this crap?? Rainbow roll was ummm.. definitely low quality, as well. Don't come here expecting to eat good sushi.. only come here if you're just craving low-grade fish and you're stuck in downtown SF. 

I guess the oyako don was okay...? Oh ew, Miley Cyrus is coming out of the speakers here. Why don't they rename this place to Sushi Teeny Bop?
author: Kazu O.

description:
Sushi Rock does not rock. 

Went here for lunch with a friend and decided to just be quick and order some bento boxes. I got saba shioyaki (dry, TINY) and sashimi (3 small ass pieces that were MEH). We also ordered a spicy tuna roll cause the bento boxes were tiny. Spicy tuna was obviously day old leftover mushy ass tuna mixed with sriracha and mayo. Nothing special and the rice was mushy also. 

Side note: Overpriced and no bueno.
author: Beverly T.

description: Best sushi hands down! This is my favorite place to come bring friends and family ! They are soo friendly and welcoming ! Plus the food is amazing and well priced ! Never takes long ! And you get free miso soup and scoops of ice cream at the end. ! Everyone must try!
author: Phoebe C.

description: Service is fast.  Food is good but I've had better.
author: Virginia C.

description: Never coming back here again.  The seafood was not fresh.  It tasted really fishy.  The sushi rolls were 95% rice, then 5% meat. If I wanted a rice roll, I would have ordered one. I expect a decent amount of meat with my sushi.  My miso soup was lukewarm. Also the rolls served did not really look like the pictures.  Overall, I was disappointed.
author: Shirleyanne A.

description:
Yikes!

This is probably the worst sushi I ever had.  I was with a friend and he wanted sushi.  I totally agreed and he took me here since it was close by.  He warned me that it was "just ok" but I wasn't expecting it to be so terrible.

The miso soup was fine and our service was mediocre at best.  Our waitress really rushed us to order and then we never saw her again until she gave us the bill and tried to rush us out the door.  But the worst part was the sushi.  MINE HAD BONES IN IT!  I can't believe I swallowed it! I shuddered as it went down and I realized what had just happened.  It tasted so gross (not to mention the fish was hardly fresh) that I didn't eat anymore.  I was done.  I'm done with this place permanently.
author: Jen K.

description:
My husband came here for an early dinner and had some of the best sushi I've ever tasted. Fresh, creative, and loaded with flavor-- we can't wait to come back!

They have a lot of choices for various prices, which is really nice.

Sushi Rock has a decent selection of Japanese beers too-- great for those of us who don't like sake!

Definitely check this place out!
author: Ashley B.

description:
At least I didn't get food poisoning. Go to Akiko's instead. I drank green tea. I ordered an unagi bowl but I think they gave me sea eel.  I should have gotten a tuna poke instead.  

I was craving a crunchy roll but they didn't have it on the menu. I'll check Yelp before I go next time. If I go back I'll sit at the sushi bar. My boyfriend got a tamago roll. Our miso soup was free but I didn't get any edamame or ice cream.
  
The cucumber salad needs more seaweed. The food is mediocre but this seemed safer than the conveyor belt sushi. They played Girls Generation and Hikki.  We sat by the open window overlooking Grant. Why do I crave Japanese food in Chinatown?
author: Ai M.

description:
Bath water sushi.

I swear that is what I taste when I eat the fish here. No atmosphere, no parking and the fish tastes as if it was fished from a child's bath water

That's all I have to say about that.
author: Fish E.

description: Our department manager took us here one day.  The service was great, as was the food, decent portions.  Very clean, modern Japanese ambience.  I wanted to give this a 3 and 1/2 stars.
author: Lawree S.

description:
Tempura green beans are SO good!

Happy hour specials on appetizers and sake are SO good!

Sushi is KIND OF good...

TV's with sports are KIND OF good...

Atmosphere is PRETTY good...

Location is PRETTY good though random...
author: Meghan P.

description:
FOOD POISONING!  BAD FISH!  QUEASY STOMACH & FREQUENT BATHROOM TRIPS THE NEXT DAY!!!

Ate here last night after the gym and the next day everyone in my party had stomach issues.  The sushi/sashimi here was the only common food any of us had that day.  Should have known since pieces like the salmon looked runny and several of the pieces smelled overly fishy (while fresh sushi should not smell that fishy).
author: Adam B.

description:
Wish i could give it 2.5 stars.  This place is in my work 'hood and its probably the best sushi in the immediate FiDi area ! 
The fish is hit or miss so I can't give it high ratings for consistency, I normally order the sashimi combo and then order a roll. 
The lunch sushi specials are good and you get a decent amount of sushi.
I've had a few rolls and they've been ok.  

All in all its an 'ok' place to eat and if you're craving sushi and are stuck in the FiDi then i'd definitely recommend this place.
author: .Vanessa G.

description:
I went to the one on polk when I was young and I loved it! I went to this one with some friends and ordered sashimi! The  slices were pretty big and tasted pretty good! The place is well decorated and they gave us big free complementary seaweed , cucumber salad , and tea which was very good! The sushi is freshly made and the food display is nice. 

They also separated our checks for us which ended our experience very well! I will definitely be coming back again sometime!
author: Victoria L.

description:
Treated my friend to lunch here today. Went in and there wasn't a line. It was around 12.15ish. The service was pretty fast and good. We got the complementary miso soup and seaweed/cucumber. The seaweed/cucumber was pretty good. 

We ordered sushi. One of them was the sexy roll. It took them a bit of time for the sushi to get there. We took our time eating the rolls. We spent like 2 hours there, just eating and chatting. They didn't rush us. T
hen we ordered the fried banana and the ice cream but the waiter was kind enough to tell us that the fried banana came with ice cream. We got to ice creams with the fried banana. One was lychee and the other was mango. Don't know if they had more flavors but it would have been nice for them to let us choose the flavors we wanted. The fried bananas were pretty good but we didn't finish cause we didn't want to eat so much trans fat. Overall the experience was good.
author: Sarah C.

description: Loved that the service was amazing and they gave me complimentary ice cream and miso soup. Ordered salmon poki and champion roll which was both good. But cannot give them 5 stars cause their salmon sashimi tasted like smoked salmon...
author: Jenny N.

description:
Last time I came here I got the Chirashi and the Deluxe special. Everything tasted fresh and clean. Up to par with any other sushi place. The service was excellent and the staff never skipped a beat. The place is stocked with flat screens. The two times that I have been here a basketball game was on - another plus for fans.

The location is okay, lots of parking on nearby streets after 6pm. Oh there seems to be some sort of discount for Academy of Art students, which I guess is because their campus is located nearby.
author: Colin H.

description:
Avoid.
Service is terrible.
Restaurant.com coupon $25 of $40 - they charge 18% tips for the TERRIBLE service and, on the top of that the tips are charged on the tax.
So if your bill is $40, prepare to pay $30 with $25 off certificate.
Besides, their sushi is so-so, place is dirty, location is full of tourists, but they should avoid it as well. Otherwise, the impression of our beautiful city may not be as good.
Just go somewhere else.
author: Sing T.

description:
Rating: 2 1/2 stars

Sushi Rock offers a wide variety of special rolls BUT they are below average. Or maybe its just this location? Today was my first time dining at Sushi Rock. I ordered the Mango Spider Roll, Dragon Roll & Ki Ki Roll.  i thought the Mango Spider Roll was JUST OK but the price was not worth it (14.95!) and the Dragon roll was JUST OK too.
