Otherwise, the restaurant was wide-open and drafty, the service slow, the sushi, tasteless. It wasn't very expensive, but at this price I've certainly had better.

Later, my dining partner returned here with his parents--he thought his dad might be keen on having a nice, big tuna steak masquerading as sashimi--but even his family wasn't really very keen on Sushi Rock.

In conclusion: bland, bland, bland. I gave it two stars instead of just one because A) I didn't DIE, and B) I didn't notice the earthquake during dinner.
author: Jenn X.

description:
I don't give Sushi Rock 4 stars for their food - its really not that great when it comes to sushi and the rest of their food (tonkatsu, teriyaki) is just average and standard like at every Japanese restaurant.   

I give it 4 stars because of the total experience.  This is probably the best venue for sushi bombing!  The staff is so friendly and they even pour the alcohol, teach you how it's done, and do the chant for you!  We had one waitress last time who even took one with us! It's all about having a good time here, and the large space accomodates large groups as well.
author: James C.

description: I order delivery service from Sushi Rock about once a week.  The sushi is fresh, tasty and the rolls have wonderful flavors.  Portions are very generous.   Great service; both on the phone at order taking and the folks that deliver.
author: Billy B.

description: Food was subpar at best. My miso soup arrived warm and the 49ers roll did not look like $10. I've had better sushi, but there was a special coupon I found online so I tried Sushi Rock. I would not recommend this to anyone. Fine for a quick sushi bite, but quality is not good.
author: Andy B.

description:
Sushi Rock is a fun place to grab a quick eat, but if you are serious about sushi I suggest a pass.  

We arrived just before happy hour ended and I received a half price lemonade martini concoction I finished in one tangy gulp.  You get what you pay for...

SR brings miso soup and a cucumber salad to the table straightaway, which is a nice touch since delving through the menu takes about 15 minutes.  

We started with the deep-fried soft shell crab, per my husband's request.  Was good, but to be fair, I have never been a huge fan anyway.  If I eat it, it's probably fair to say it was a good SSC roll.  (I didn't eat it).

We ordered 3 rolls, none of which were thrilling enough to actually remember their names.  What did stand out was the loud-ass R&B music. 

Give it a whirl if you are on Polk and need to eat in less than an hour before you catch a show at The Hemlock.
author: Hannah A.

description:
This is an alright sushi place. Went here with coworkers for lunch, and all I can say is the sushi was okay. Average. Not the absolute freshest. They do have a large variety of specialty rolls, including both raw and cooked items, plus the standard teriyaki fare, so anyone can find at least one thing on the menu they like. It's very hard to screw up teriyaki.

Usually I leave a sushi place feeling full and content. I left here feeling full and kinda oogy in the stomach, and from eating less than I usually do. If I go again, I will be sticking to their teriyaki lunches, but for sushi I will continue to poke around downtown searching for a better place.

They do have a nice view of the corner of Grant and Pine, so it's not a bad place to eat and people watch.
author: Higgins D.

description:
My smoked salmon roll was just fine, it hit the spot even though it was forgotten moments after I finished. More memorable was having the counter to myself and watching the sushi chef do his thing. It was rather mesmerizing, and I appreciated the chance to personally thank him for his work.

Decent sushi artfully prepared. At least today.
author: Jason B.

description: I have been going to Sushi Rock for 10 years and never had any problem with food, waitresses or the quality of service. Parking can be painful sometimes but don't forget just a minute across the street  they have validated parking.
author: Ken B.

description: I liked this place! It was located in the heart of "ChinaTown!" I loved the ambiance! The staff was great, waaaay friendlier than the Asian waitresses in the South that i've dealt with! They were friendly, talkative and on point! They were enthusiastic and treated us like kings! They were joking with us and talking to us like human beings! What a shock! In the ATL, some spots act like they don't want "us" in there! They tend to be real "Dry" down here! lol! But not in San Fran! I had some Fried stuff and "The Golden Gate" Sushi rolls! Very BIG and Tasty! We had Sake and some other stuff too! I liked the ambiance, the staff and the portions! It was more of a experience as well! They're TV's were big and in HD as well! This place really does "Rock!" The people in there were friendly too!
author: Michael O.

description:
the udon was fine. the drowned beetle was not.
to be fair they were very polite about the whole thing and the complimentary green tea ice cream was quite tasty. it was just hard to stay any longer than absolutely necessary.
author: adriana n.

description:
Love, love, LOVE this place!

Fast, friendly service, excellent and fresh sushi! They quickly seat you and get you squared away with miso and seaweed salad...

The one roll with the mango is excellent...

FREE ICE CREAM for dessert! :)
author: Michelle K.

description:
Sushi Rock has a pretty large sushi roll menu.  The specialty rolls were also very inventive.  In particular, we had a Mango Spider Roll that was very creative.  The 8-piece salmon sashimi order was also very fresh, and the slices were pretty thick.  The Daegi roll (mix of spicy tuna and scallop) we had came with a very generous size piece of scallop, but was a touch too spicy for me.  Finally, this is the first time I've seen smoked salmon rolls (not the skin, but actual smoked salmon) and it was very tasty.

I also like the nice touches of the free seaweed, cucumber salad and miso soup to start and scoop of coconut ice cream to end.  I certainly don't turn down free food :)

The service was also great, considering we had a promo $25 gift certificate, and didn't end up spending that much $ out of pocket.
author: Mon L.

description: If you're hungry... Get the box. Tons of food. Pick 3 and get salad and rice. Amazing sushi. Beers good. Not expensive. What more can you ask for?
author: Morgan A.

description: This little sushi restaurant had an overwhelming list of different sushi rolls to try from.  I ordered the philly roll, the sexy roll, and was able to sample the hamachi and tempura. How they came up with the sexy roll is an enigma to me -- a california roll topped with salmon and tobiko then further topped with melted kraft american cheese singles.  What!?!  Not so sexy, but oddly not so bad.  I much more enjoyed the philly roll which was one of the better philly rolls I've had.  I wouldn't mind going back again to try some of the other rolls but will probably stay away from any other suggestively named ones.
author: Erich D.

description:
This place is decent for lunch.  But I wouldn't pick this place since there are so many good Japanese restaurants around. 

Everything here are just decent, not memorable.  Pretty good selection of rolls, combination lunch specials.  And I do like the seaweed appetizer they give you for free.
author: Gigi T.

description:
So I get why other people dont love this place. Dining in leaves something to  be desired. However, they are fast and fabulous when it comes to take out. 

You see, I live just around the corner and have a 24/7 sushi craving which i give in to more than I'd like to admit. They are relatively inexpensive and are so damn friendly. I've lived in this area a month, they know my order.

i aint too proud..
author: Erin F.

description: First time eating here for a friend's birthday and I was VERY disappointed because I ordered tuna sashimi bowl and only gave me 6 small pieces for $15.95, it wasn't even FRESH. Than when our bill came in they over charged us $60.00 MORE!! This is the worst sushi place ever and believe me I'm a sushi fan.
author: Traviz C.

description:
SF Food Inspection Score: 84

hmmm, wish they could raise that score a bit.

oh well! i likey this place. they have non stop sushi that's creative, fun, and a party in my mouf!

they have prettay good deals on lunch specials and man they are quick. i guess being in the fi di can make you a super speedy server!

never been disappointed here and will definitely come back for the lunch rush again!
author: Kristina C.

description:
SInce moving to San Francisco this is the only  sushi places I have visited though I have been told about other ones that are better, I have yet to try them. 

But so far the service has been good. Friendly waitress and waiters. The sushi has been good every time I have gone. They bring it out very quickly. Of course I have only been on the weekdays.
author: Tori B.

description:
Having confused this place for Sushi Zone in Hayes Valley (http://www.yelp.com/biz/sushi-zone-san-francisco), I was pretty excited for some fresh fish.  Alas, this is NOT Sushi Zone, and nothing stood out about this place.  I'm pretty sure it's not even Japanese-owned, which is always disappointing.  The rolls were decent - not terrible, not great.  The service was ok - not terrible, not great.  

Some positive things I can say about Sushi Rock are: there was no wait, and I don't think it came out to be that expensive (I went way back in January...).  Also, it was a pretty fast meal - always a plus.  So, even though I probably won't be coming back, it's not horrible, and is probably the place for you if you're craving not terrible, not great sushi.
author: Kira K.

description:
Not the best, but I like this place. 
Everything my boyfriend and I ordered was pretty good. I love the Salmon Snow Roll and the Una Ten or something roll. The Hamachi was just OK, though, it was kind of bland. I enjoyed the donburi with the beef, egg and onions, maybe could have used more sauce.

They have some sushi roll combos I've never had before, so I like that.
Decent priced sushi and I didn't try any specials, but seems like bento boxes and happy hour for drinks are pretty cheap. 

Also, free miso soup, cucumber salad and ice cream (coconut/green tea)!!!! I am not a big fan of coconut, but I enjoyed their coconut ice cream! I would come again.
author: Jamie W.

description:
Review is based on price performance. We arrived just after Happy Hour, but my friend Jerusha (http://thelastsinglegirlintheworld.com) had the bento (rock box) which was still very attractively priced, containing 3 items: seabass teriyaki, shrimp tempura and oyster katsu. I had the sashimi dinner which was good although at $16.75 not cheap but reasonable.  We loved the free seaweed and cucumber salad at the beginning of the meal so got an extra one for $3.95. Also ordered the grilled squid appetizer $7.95, which was great.  Total before tip with one sake $50.
Location was convenient to where I was staying (Park55) and attending (Moscone). I needed to plug in my laptop and there were lots of plugs on the wall and no one complained. Jerusha didn't appreciate 2 blocks up from Montgomery on Pine but I was wearing sneakers.  All in all we were both happy.
author: Linda S.

description:
For those of you wondering where this new Sushi Rock is, it is about a block away from that Chinatown gate thing and is by the corner on the second floor.

The menu and prices are the same as far as I can tell from the original Polk St. store. They still serve free seaweed and soup to all patrons.

The food quality is just mediocre but still quite a bargain so I do welcome this new addition to the limited selection of sushi places by the Financial District area.
author: Tommy T.

description:
If you walk into this place and expect superb sushi, you should not write about any Japanese/sushi restaurant. If you haven't been to the second floor bathrooms at New Asia on Pacific off Stockton, you do not know what scary is.

I like this place for a quick, in the hood, no frills sushi dinner. The price could be lower for the quality of sushi they're serving but I can tolerate.

Nice thing is they immediately give you miso soup, a seaweed cucumber appetizer, and water once you've sat down. Free ice-cream at the end too. 

Nigiri:
Saba was forgetable; Mirugai always unavailable; Amaebi was decent (served with deep-fried shrimp head, a must for me); Suzuki was acceptable; Tai was rubbery; Unagi above average

Maki:
Negihama, NY, and spicy scallop rolls were HUGE; caterpillar was quite acceptable given the time taken to make it.

I'll add to the list when I order more next time. This place is run by Canto-Chinese. I find it acceptably clean, including the bathrooms.
author: DANIEL T.

description:
Our go-to place for sushi delivery... They deliver fast and and food has been ok so far.. Their duck sushi wasn't so yummy though :( 

Nice place in general and definitely would recommend this if you live in the nob hill area as we do. :)
author: Rv G.

description:
I go there to this place frequently, for the very simple fact that I get a great deal. I love the salad and miso soup. That is always a plus. You have have a box meal and be out with 12 bucks for dinner before tip and taxes of course. After work, a long day of dealing with clients and equipment that does not work, just plopping down at the sushi bar and gorging myself on lots of really good stuff makes me feel better. 

I very seldom order rolls or anything that is not raw. I have ordered oysters and that was not bad. Too bad it was like 8 of them and I forgot the strength of Sriracha and for a while i pounded a lot of water, not going to order that that sauce on that again. Their sashimi comes pretty fresh and so far I have not gotten sick from it. 

I enjoy this place a lot and have been there many many times alone and with a few people.
author: Christopher C.

description:
Free Miso & Salad, 
When you come in the door, then
Great fish free ice cream.
author: Brian J.

description: We went here because we were staying at a nearby hotel. The food was okay. Nothing special. The miso tasted a little fishy, california roll was small and made differently, tuna sushi was fresh. The gyoza was okay. The service was fast, no nonsense. I think this place is better for an older crowd, not a familly.
author: Judy C.

description: I have nothing but good things to say about this place.  They catered our holiday party last night.  The sushi was delicious, the staff that I worked with was friendly and very accommodating.
author: Stephanie H.

description: Standard sushi fare on the edge of chinatown. It was a Thursday evening and we were one of two groups in the entire night. Salmon could have been a little fresher and the spicy tuna a little spicier for my taste
author: Roberta B.

description: Unagi donburi was donboring. And it's almost insulting to include a few leaves of chopped iceberg lettuce and 1k island dressing. And the orange slice resting against the pickled daikon... okay, I'll stop.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Ordered a Polk St. Special and a Asahi Dry Beer. Can't really put the taste of the beer on the restaurant, but I can do that with the sushi that was on my place. It was okay for the most part. At least they validate parking at a garage close by. That's a plus, right?
author: Gerard Y.

description: I go to his place regularly (they take "knight kash" which is money my school gives students that can be used at specific restaurants") and I always love the food. I only give it three stars because the service is slow at times, and once I got chicken that was undercooked. The servers are nice, though, and the view is pretty good. They also always play good music, living up to their name. If you go on a weeknight you'll get your food in under ten minutes, but for some reason they always take a good 15 minutes to bring your check. If you're in the area, I definitely suggest you check it out!
author: Miranda P.

description:
I work in the financial district, and have been ordering from Sushi Rock for like four years, ordering dinner for a group probably on average once a week. Their delivery times are spotty... but today is unbelievable.  Called them at 5:15pm.  It's now 6:45.  I called to ask for this order for free... one of my companions for the order had to leave before the food arrived.  I called them twice to check on the status, and they keep telling me that it's coming soon, the driver is stuck in traffic.  I'm like half a mile away. and given that I am a regular customer, you'd think they'd offer me the order for free.  They offered me 10% off my next order.  Seriously? 

I'm never ordering from these guys again.  If the manager reads this, comes to his senses, and wants to trade the value of my ridiculously late order (about $50) for thousands of dollars a year in lost business... I'm all ears.

Otherwise... Vendetta!
author: Nunya B.

description: We head here for lunch sometimes.  My coworkers like the sushi enough (nothing to write home about, but cheap).  I order the teriyaki bento box with veggie tempura. It's edible, nothing special. The salad is pretty good.  I sometimes get sick after eating here and spend a considerable amount of time in the bathroom the rest of the day.
author: Jordan F.

description:
The sushi was tasty.
We went here before the LoveFest AfterParty... considering the "theme" of that night, I ordered the Roll'n Roll. It was interesting in a good way. Not very filling, but I guess that's the way it should be before a night of debauchery.
The service was good and I was able to watch ESPN and other football while we waited for our food. Prices weren't too bad either, considering the location and cuisine.
author: Jae A.

description:
I went here for dinner yesterday. The salmon sashimi was average (not bad, maybe cut a little oddly). Hamachi sashimi was pretty good but surprisingly expensive compared to other menu items.

I ordered the tuna salmon tartare which was a little disappointing. But we did ask them to work 'off-menu' and make us a spicy salmon roll, which they did. The rice was a little too mushy, but other than that everything was fine.

Service was fast and good. I think it's a little expensive for what it is.
author: Amanda F.

description:
It's been a while since I've been here and the main thing that sticks in mind is their happy hour special on drinks: buy 2 get 1 free..... which when applied to Sake bottles... is awesome!!!
They also had AWESOME music playin, so despite the ok sushi, we were pumped and havin a great time!
author: Sofia J.

description:
Sushi Rock is a place that I had written off as being just a well positioned tourist spot near chinatown and hotels.
The work crew was really craving some sushi on a Saturday lunchtime and our regular spot was closed. 
We were not dissapointed.
We ordered 8 different kinds of rolls and each one was delicious.
It wasnt outrageously priced either. It wasnt cheap, but what we payed was reflected in the size and quality of the rolls.
Their sushi really does rock ;)
author: Melissa B.

description:
Great late night place.  Walking around in search of a place to eat, we ended up at Sushi Rock. It's open till on Friday.  We came a little late as the kitchen was going to close, but the staff was friendly about it.  The waitress brought us complimentary miso soup and some cucumber and seaweed salad-a nice bonus we sometimes take for granted.

I ordered a California roll ($5) and a Golden Gate roll -($6.5) and it was perfect.  The rice inside the roll was so soft and tasty. The albacore in the GG roll was delicious.  

My husband got some sort of Udon Noodle bowl which was plentiful. I'm not too fond of that because it's kind of bland most places I've been.  He thought it was okay.  

Afterwords, the waitress came with another surprise bonus- a free mini scoop of ice cream.  I got green tea and my husband got coconut. Wow...that was REAL ice cream.  Yum.

Our total bill was about 21 which was VERY reasonable.  

I would definately recommend this place.
author: Jessica E.

description:
We visit this restaurant whenever we are in Union Square. Not many sushi restaurants are open on Sundays. We like this place because its convenient when shopping in the area and the atmosphere is relaxing. Very casual environment, not too much to the decor other than the large windows overlooking the street and HD tvs.

We've only had sushi here and the sushi is decent. The selection is good and the prices are reasonable. The service is good. At the end of the meal they gave complimentary green tea and lychee ice cream. Nice way to end the meal and a day of shopping.
author: Michelle T.

description: Dragon Roll, Rainbow Roll, Rock&Roll, they're all good. I haven't had bad sushi here yet. Service is fantastic, and I've even gotten take out from here. I called in, and told them I would pick it up within 20minutes. I arrive, and it's all bundled up. They also deliver, which is cool. I docked off a star because the one time they did deliver, it took longer than expected and the delivery guy expected us to pay for the sushi when we had already paid over the phone with a credit card. He called the restaurant up and it was sorted out. Maybe inform the delivery guys when customers should pay upon delivery and when they've already done so? Other than that, their sushi is great. They've also given free ice cream to try (lychee and mango - yumm!).
author: Sami A.

description: This place had the most plain, not so good tasting sushi ever!! My friend and I love sushi & we've been to so many sushi places, but we both agree this is the worst of the worst. The place looked cool & we were definitely excited, but we did not expect what we got. For the prices that we paid, if we went to another sushi place, we would get fabulous sushi that had flavor, sauce, special anything!! But at this place, they just gave me typical raw fish with rice, no sauce on top, no flavor, no anything. The fish was not that tasteful either, which just made it even worse. My friend & I warn people to never go here since there are WAYYYYY better sushi places that has better prices and or better flavors.
author: Marie R.

description: The stars are for the service. Which was great. Uber friendly and super fast. The food was so mediocre it made me want to cry though. However, my friend and I were dying of hunger so we mowed through it. It didn't make me feel sick afterward...but I sure as hell didn't feel satisfied.
author: Mia M.

description: While this place was close and I was craving good sushi, I was hoping to find some in Chinatown (yes I know sushi is japanese)...I was the first customer of the day...i was hoping for fresh sushi. What I got was very bland, definitely not fresh, and very disappointing.  I am convinced that this Miso soup was made with urine and at least a week old.  It seems like from the past reviews this is a place you have got to be drunk to enjoy....The service i received was decent and the staff was nice enough, but this is definitely the TACO BELL OF THE SUSHI WORLD.  If i were to return, it would be for the cheap liquor and not the food...if you are looking for anything of quality, DO NOT GO HERE,...if you want to sip cheap sake on happy hour and soak it up with Safeway style sushi....then this is the place for you...for me it was just a mistake.
author: Jack F.

description: The staff were extremely friendly at the sushi bar. Very friendly, inviting atmosphere. The [farmed] fish was fresh too.
author: Josh T.

description:
I don't know, maybe this is my first time here and there's not enough to say about Sushi Rock. This has an overall score of 2 and a half stars. I guess it's fun, no matter what place you're at, if you have a fun group of friends dining with you. I certainly enjoyed the California Rolls and they were tasty. I use the California rolls as a bench mark to test the taste of other Sushi places, and this was the best. We also had a tasty birthday "cake" made from bananas with chocolate (?) and green tea ice cream and one candle!

This place is right in the heart of Chinatown with lots of tourists dressed in shorts, sandals and tank tops. Its funny to see because it gets cold here in the Summer in San Francisco! Have to try the other Sushi Rocks around the City.
author: herm p.

description:
I like Sushi Rock. It's mediocre sushi but it's at a great price. No one can beat the price of their happy lunch bento boxes!! THREE choices for only $7.95. It's fabulous! It's a quick walk from the FiDi so I love coming here for lunch. When you dine-in, they serve you miso soup and some seaweed/cucumber dish, I think.

I think they're very nice people and the service is always good!
author: J T.

description:
Sure, the staff is all Chinese with varying levels of English fluency, and the music is kinda loud, but the food is good and (generally) quick.

Their standout dish is the house cold noodle -- I'm a vegetarian so I haven't had the ones with meat -- a combination of cold noodles, seaweed, cabbage, egg and some kind of spicy ponzu sauce. Always hit the spot when I went there for lunch.

If your lunch companions are boring, you can always gaze up at FSN or ESPN. ;-)
author: Lily Ann B.

description:
Sushi Rock is a pretty good place to go for lunch since their specials are so cheap.  It's not the BEST sushi in town, but it will do... especially for a  $7.95 Happy Lunch Box combo!

You get your choice of 3 items, miso soup, and salad.  Items include: 

*4 piece California roll
*Chicken Teriyaki
*4 piece Avocado Roll
*5 piece Tempura
*2 piece Inari
*Saba Shioyaki/Teriyaki
*Beef Teriyaki
* Tofu Teriyaki
*4 piece Gyoza
*2 piece Shrimp Tempura
*4 piece Kappa Roll
*Chicken Katsu
*Tonkatsu

They have other decently priced lunch specials too (http://www.sushirocksf.com/lunch.html) and they always give a free appetizer like edamame, picked cucumbers, or seaweed salad to each table.  Yum! =)
author: Marilou A.

description:
All in all, this is a solid sushi joint. I like to switch up on the specialty rolls but always lean towards the "Sweet Sixteen" roll and TT Roll - YUM.

I'm a huge veggie tempura fan. While their tempura isn't anything to write home about, the portions are generous.

The service is usually spot-on, operating very efficiently and smoothly. Weekend dinner rush has may leave them swamped, though.

If you're anywhere nearby and sushi's on your mind (or on your stomach), Sushi Rock is a sure bet.
author: Matthew J M.

description: LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT!!  This place well..  ROCKS!! LOL!! This is a must order..  The Crunchy Stars ORDER THEM If they are not on your table there is something wrong with you.  The sishi here is good and such a big variety of stuff to order from.  The Donburi is a must as well. The AC is weak so it gets stuffy in there so makesure you sit near a window.
author: Kevin G.

description: For an untraditional dining experience, come to sushi rock--where the music rocks harder than the food.
author: Alex H.

description: Service was awful. We ordered three sushi rolls that took over 45 minutes to make. Two sushi chefs. And a restaurant that was half full. We were serviced last over people who sat long after us.  I would never go back here. More so because the sushi wasn't that good.
author: Jessica M.

description:
They're not bad on a weekday evening when they're relatively empty.  However, I wouldn't recommend coming here when it's busy, chances are the service will suffer greatly and you'll have to plan on being their longer.

But, the food is great, reasonably priced, and if you have an Entertainment card you can get a really good discount on your and your friends' entire order of sushi.

If you don't think this place is your "cup of tea", there are a few other sushi places in the area that I hear are good as well.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Ya know not bad sushi.  They have a cool atmosphere there and a lot of different stuff.  It's nothing that will blow you away, but you won't be disappointed with it at all.  

Good place overall.
author: Aaron G.

description:
The rolls aren't bad.  The miso soup is good.  The ice cream to finish the meal are good.  The fish for the nigiri even seems to be reasonable quality, but they seem to have missed the point.  The pieces were just way too large.  

In the case of sushi, bigger is not better.  It's difficult to enjoy and savor gigantic pieces of fish.
author: James D.

description:
Food wasn't bad as we came during happy hour so appetizers were cheap as was the sake. Wait was a little longer than i felt it should have been. Overall the food wasn't anymore different from any other sushi place. A little pricier for "fancier" rolls though.




bring your AAA card for a discount.
author: Dan N.

description: The complementary seaweed salad was super vinegary. The futo-maki was a little bit anemic and everything was quite salty. Nothing too special but not too bad either.
author: Michael H.

description: Okay for late night cravings for "okay" sushi, donburi and tempura. But never ever the curry. Worst katsu curry I've ordered in my life. The sauce tasted like it came out of a box. Ugh.
author: Frances L.

description:
what is up with this place???  The sushi is good, but the service is always so bizarre??

I have eaten here only two times, but BOTH times was the same story.  Walk in, greeted and seated promptly.  Offered water, tea or sake, and then they disappear.  For 10-15 minutes.  I have had to wave someone down BOTH times.  then when it's time for the bill, same thing.  I always think of sushi as fast.  A quick lunch.  Even though they are always fully staffed, it seems like they're just chattin' away back there... HELLLLLO, there are patrons to take care of????  

I just don't get it?
author: michelle g.

description:
Do not order anything raw from this place.  Some of the fish had a funky color to it. eeewww....

Go ahead and order their fried items.  anything deep fried is good anyway.
author: J S.

description:
AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

Man this place is just garbage.  G A R B A G E !  The place was dirty, floor wasn't swept, tables weren't bussed, and the bathroom was rates top ten as "Chinatown's Scariest Bathroom".  The food is definitely not fresh and sushi rice was prepared poorly.  We order deep fried squid and it was burnt to a crisp.  We ordered sake and we had "floaters" in our drinks.  Nasty.
author: Buddy R.

description:
What they cant rock, they roll. I think its funny when none of the sushi chefs are japanese... but sushi rock can make a mean dish. The price/proportion ratio is great. I never leave this place hungry. The sushi is basic, not much creativity, but the fish quality isnt bad.  This place is definitely worth hittin' up. Check out their sake list... off the hook.

Copied from their to go menu
Free delivery with a minimum $20 order 5pm-10pm everyday
www.sushirockssf.com
415-399-0882
open 11am-10pm daily

happy hour 3:30pm to 6:30pm EVERYDAY
all drinks 50% appetizers 25% off
author: Jay P.

description: After a long day of walking from the Ferry Building, to Coit Tower, through Chinatown, Sushi Rock was an oasis of respite. We enjoyed the cuke salad, miso soup that came with every meal. I had one of the unusual rolls-the Phoenix I think- shrimp tempura, avocado, with unagi on top and fake crab (for some reason they use that as topping). I was pretty famished, and it did hit the spot. Service was fairly good. They answered our many questions about their odd roll selections. Did not try Nigiri so can't comment on that...  for an East Coast person, this restaurant was great- it's like baby steps if you don't want to sink in to the raw fish right away.
author: Suzanne P.

description:
Why eat at a chain when there are so many better independent places out there? 

Do we really need to be watching Celebrity Race car drivers while eating sushi? 

Asi asi at best. It's open an hour later which is the only reason I stopped in and wouldn't seek it out in case of an emergency late night sushi craving.
author: Jennine C.

description:
Sushi Rock rocks!

Everything is priced well and they have those cool state of the art pda order takers. Everything is quick and neat, never a problem with slow serice. Good happy hour that I always seem to miss (never remember time) with 1/2 off apps. and drinks. Always good music!

I was going to give four stars but the more I thought about it the more I realized I have never had a bad experience. Having worked in a restaurant I have weird quirks about some things and Sushi Rocks satisfies them all.

O ya and once I saw a non-asian working there, almost blew my mind.
author: Jess R.

description: Cheap and bad quality sushi. The only reason why i'm giving them 3 stars is, for their Happy hour drinks and their attentive service.  If you want cheap drinks go there i believe all the drinks are 50% off during HH.
author: Raymond C.

description: Great sushi and affordable prices! Loved that the dinner included a seweed salad and miso soup for free. Everyone was very friendly and sushi was fresh and creative. Definitely going back and would recommend to anyone in the downtown area. Descent atmosphere, great televisions for the sports enthusiast, and an awesome finish with a free scoop of green tea and vanilla ice cream!
author: Isabel F.

description:
The rule about not eating sushi in Chinatown isn't quite fair when many would argue that the best Chinese food is not in Chinatown.  That said, this place is just average.  I've eaten there several times.  Sometimes the food has been great (rolls, nigiri, etc.), but sometimes I felt that the nigiri (at least my experience with the shiro maguro) was a little off.  If a restaurant is off even once, I often don't return.  
3 stars for the affordability, the good service, and the good meals that I had there.
author: Lulu B.

description:
It's my first time to eat here and I had no idea this place is by China Town! Here's what I think. The restaurant had a friendly staff and good food.

Had four different orders:
1. Spicy Tuna Roll with scallops and tobiko *** (ok)
2. Spider Roll ***** (delish)
3. Albacore sashimi **** (good)
4. And a poki handroll *** (ok)
author: Anna L.

description:
We used to go to Sushi Rock a lot, because they have cheap food and good happy hour deals. The service is pushy and are constantly trying to get you to order within 5 minutes of being there.

One night we ate there and my friend got food poisoning from them and was sick her entire birthday weekend. We thought it might be a fluke, so we went back another weekend and another friend got food poisoning for the entire weekend as well. I understand that you are taking a risk at a sushi joint, but two weekends in a row to two different people? Yikes.
author: Sarah M.

description: I've been here a few times for lunch during the week and always the service is SLOW SLOW SLOW.  Today though was the final straw; I ordered Rock N Roll and it was covered in this mysterious brown sauce.  I have some food allergies (wheat) so I should have know better to ask first.  So I went to the Sushi "chef" behind the counter and asked what was in the sauce.  He grunted unagi sauce.  Like I know what unagi sauce is.  So I asked again, is there soy sauce in there?  He said yes and that it was unagi sauce.  So I thought I might have better luck with the waiter, but no, same deal.  Rude and unfriendly.  You're not missing out... the sushi isn't even that good.
author: Karen N.

description:
I've never eaten in this restaurant!

So why am I reviewing it?  Because I get the takeout platters once a week. For a busy mom on the go, they're a lifesaver.   They're consistently very good (not great) sushi, Combo platters that are good stuff, as opposed to mostly california rolls, and the prices are good.

These guys send me a coupon in the mail every week, plus they're on the back of safeway receipts and in those Val-pak things!
author: Victoria B.

description:
Yum!
great rolls, fabulous veggie tempura and good prices (cheap relative to most sushi places). 
i don't know why the other reviewers didn't like it.
author: Carrie M.

description: By far my favorite sushi place in all of San Francisco. Get the Otokoyama sake. It tastes like Rain! Free Ice cream for desert. LOVE IT!
author: Josh E.

description: Go for Happy Hour - 50% off drinks and 25% off apps.  The only average tasting app we had was the gyoza.  Hamachi chin, deep fried stars, croquettes, grilled squid, chicken skewers, and taco ginger (octopus) were tasty.  Rock on!
author: Doc M.

description: Not sure how others could rate this place above 2 stars when there are so many other amazing sushi bars around San Francisco.  Tried this place because of my hotel's recommendation and it was one of the closest around.  Take the extra few blocks to go to other spots.
author: Hwn T.

description: The only good things about this place are its online delivery system (I'm partial to GrubHub.com) and they accept Restaurant.com gift certificates when you dine in-house. This place is so overpriced for mediocre sushi/sashi/udon.
author: Adrienne C.

description:
This is like dog food wrapped in rice. I just had to suffer through another office order of this crap. Last week one of my coworkers reported he was sick after eating this filth. 

I just bit into a california roll at my desk and felt a crunch, something awful (and even worse was the surprise and the texture). 

I've also been to their actual restaurant once, and couldn't wait to leave. A Tijuana cantina is cleaner and more appealing. 

Heres to fresh, real, quality sushi. Eff all the rest.
author: Jared C.

description:
Pros: free sampling of coconut ice cream, fresh sashimi
Cons: small portions (soft shell crab)
author: Jenny K.

description: Good sushi, great house sake, prompt service and good location.  Wonderful value
author: Mark T.

description: I went in thinking I had a 15% coupon on my cell phone that I had received as a text message.  Nothing was mentioned that you had to have a smartphone that would allow you to reply back  to the text message with the cost of the bill so as to get a code from them.    What a rip off?    Not everyone has a smartphone or iphone.   I wish they would word their coupon special accurately
author: c t.

description: I am just honestly in love with their tofu teriyaki! It is such a deal to get the lunch or dinner bento box and eat up! For non-vegetarians there is a huge selection of rolls to chose from, many intriguing. I also looove the free ice cream after your meal, mmm coconut :)
author: Cori W.

description: The GF and I had a good experience here on a Sunday early evening; good seaweed salad appetizer and good sashimi combos, and, as it happens, good service. Take that for what its worth.
author: Matt W.

description: I have been to this location a few times as it's right next to our store, Satin Crystals and very convenient and easy to eat at! There are better places for sushi quality, but the service is quick and the food I have ordered here has been good. You get miso and seaweed salad complimentary. There is plenty of seating and its a quick fix if you're craving sushi but don't want to think of new places to go.
author: Sheila S.

description:
bigger isn't always better.

sushi rock seems to favor quantity over quality.  each piece of nigiri is ginormous, requiring 2-3 bites each.  i suppose if you're relatively new to sushi and want to get full real quick, this place is pretty good.

but a slightly more discriminating palette will quickly learn that, even after taking several bites, you still don't seem to get the full flavor *good* sushi offers.  i'll take 1/2 bite of top quality fish over a mouthful of so-so, could have, should have fish.
author: vuForce Fresh n.

description:
This place is as good as it gets HH style.  Take advantage of the Happy Hour to the YinYang! 3:30- 6:30 EVERYDAY with late night special  Fri and Sat 10-12:30 am. Instead of early bar hopping where they usually dont serve food, just stop by and get your overloading dose of sake bomb and definitely it'll get ur night going.  
I heard about this place on the radio (92.7) and they mentioned that u get to eat sushi while u "roll" on house music. Ok I tried. There was three of us and we've ordered almost everything on the app menu except for octopus and fried bean curd. The Hamachi Kama is to die for! Cooked to perfection. Even my grossed out coworker learned to love it. I had ordered 3 different rolls (philly, rainbow, spider) which I ate most of.  And I cant past the  opportunity to not get my Ikura and Uni which I ate by myself. Yah, it was sushi buffet made in heaven for me. We've ordered 3  Asahi bottle, cold and hot sake, all the cocktails they offer HH price which only narrowed to 3. Nonetheless I was a happy camper with a full belly to last me for a week...atleast. 

(free mochi dessert...heheh)
author: Rovie T.

description: Cute sushi joint in Chinatown. The sashimi wasn't that fresh but the sake still tasted like butter! We had the seared tuna and the seaweed cucumber salad for appetizers and it wasn't all that great. The rolls however were a different story. Formula: Sushi + fruit = awesome! My favs were the mango spider and mango tuna. Pretty inexpensive - bill was under $100 for 6 people. Bonus - free mango/taro ice cream for dessert.
author: Cheryl P.

description: This place is VERY overrated. I had heard so much about from friends that I had high expectations going. I went with my boyfriend who wasn't even in the mood for sushi, but I told him I had heard such good things about them so we went. He had the teriyaki chicken and it was horrible, it was so bland and it wasn't even hot when the brought it out. I ordered new york a roll it was good, but not the best I've ever had. The decor and service are nice though. I really wanted to order the sushi lunch special but it was too late in the evening. I'll have to go back during lunch, the lunch specials are super cheap!
author: Leslie A.

description: If you like mayonnaise, go to Sushi Rock.  I ate here a long time ago, had a horrible meal.  The fish tasted off, every roll had a nasty mayonnaise sauce on it, and the place was packed with loud teenagers (or immature adults) . Did not enjoy it one bit.  I think people flock to this place for the price specials but the sushi is really yucky.  I cant believe people go there at all, especially in a town with so much good sushi!  What are you people thinking?
author: Nilu r.

description: ehhhh not amazed, but not horrible.  The sashimi wasnt bad.  The rolls were a little below even average for me.  Love how each meal comes with seaweed/cucumber salad, miso soup, and ice cream after.  Service was great!  The rolls could definately use some help, but if you are ordering only rolls (especially california rolls), you must not really be a sushi lover anyway lol.  Some of the fish could be a little more fresh, but again I dont think the place is horrible....and the service is awesome.  come everytime I'm in China Town for my Sashimi fix.
author: Brandon H.

description: I go here for lunch all the time.  It's our destination of choice when it comes to bday, going away, and just random lunches.  I always get lunch special D because it has enough variety and not the gross stuff.  I also really like their spicy scallop salad roll or their daegi roll.  Sometimes the service sucks and sometimes they don't  understand english.  Then i bust out with my cantonese.  Yes, its a chinese run japanese restaurant/bar.  I've never been for their happy hour but i think thats where i'll go next time.  We'll see.
author: Aaron G.

description:
how to enjoy sushi rock in chinatown:

step 1: go to sushi rock
step 2: enjoy the complimentary wakame salad and miso soup
step 3: order the $11.95 bento with 2 portions of sea bass shioyaki and a sashimi of your liking for $1 extra
step 4: take your time and enjoy every morsel of the sea bass

i would pass on the actual sushi... it's decent but the rolls are really tiny in size. stick with the bento with some sashimi to quench your raw fish tendencies and you'll do fine.
author: Andrey C.

description: We had some out-of-towners in town and were doing the usual tourist stops.  For some unfortunate reason I thought I had heard this place was pretty good -- but I heard wrong.   For starters they bring you miso soup and seaweed salad on the house.  The soup lacked flavor and the salad was so so.  We ordered a few rolls which were ok - again pretty bland.  The place was bare...I think there was maybe one other couple there.  We had a table that overlooked China Town which was great for people watching.  The staff was  friendly but overall it's not a memorable place.  I will probably never go back. Luckily our guest weren't big sushi eaters!
author: Angie C.

description: Not sure why people are giving this place bad reviews. I've had a good experience everytime I've been. The waiters are nice, the food comes quick, and it is good. Sorry for those who don't like it!
author: Mama C.

description: Just wasn't that impressed with anything about this place. Granted this is SF and you gotta grade sushi on a curve so this was ok in another city but not here where the options are plentiful.
author: kevin h.

description: Definately not my choice for sushi. I've been here a couple of times and the experience was the same. However, I do hear that they have a great happy hour menu, never tried that.
author: meL Z.

description: This is okay.  I was starving for sushi and tried it out after work on my way home but, wasn't impressed.  It's cheap and what can you say?  $20 bucks will buy a huge platter here.  That is all I can add on this one.  The wait staff and service is very good.  I was not impressed with my combo platter.
author: Wendy B.

description: with two this is really not a recommendation.  The place smelled poorly and the floor was sticky.  The wait for my simple order took forever.  though, I did see the chief cleaning several large salmons and they were beautiful.  I am on the fence with this place it's so inviting with the cool over chinatown view, but it smells pretty bad.  My sushi was good and now that's it about 10:00pm and still haven't tossed my cookies is a good sign....
author: JO Y.

description: Rolls and sushi were decent, as was the sake selection.  Creative use of mango and tuna in the roll.  Yellow fin was very tender.  Otherwise fairly basic cuisine.  Gets an extra star for the service; very friendly, changed the tvs around so I could see a game, and the inclusive miso, seaweed salad, and mango icecream were nice.
author: Judd H.

description: My girlfriend Lioness took me here for lunch one day and since we work in the FiDi - it's clearly an easy walk uphill into Chinatown. We noshed on the tempura fried green beans (yum) and their complimentary cucumber and seaweed salad. I tried their spicy tuna roll and the fast food joint wasn't bad. Service was good and I plan to go here again!
author: Mika D.

description: I had lunch here today while running errands downtown.  The food was solid, but the service and price really make this place four stars.  Not crazy about the name but I would go back.
author: Amy G.

description: I came for lunch and had a bento with shrimp tempura, chicken teriyaki and California rolls. It also came with soup, and a couple of salads. The food was ok but the tempura was very disappointing, price was ok..around $9 for lunch.
author: Tania J.

description: Their lunch and dinner 3-item bento box specials are definitely a bargain!  Although the food is just average, it is good for the price you pay.  I like getting take-out orders from them when I can't leave my desk at lunch since they are quite fast and really pack your food well.  You get a miso soup even when you order a take-out order on a lunch item that normally comes with soup.
author: Annie L.

description: My husband and I went to Sushi Rock for our Valentine's Day lunch. They had a pretty good lunch combination. My husband ordered the Sashimi Combination ($12ish) and I got the choose 3 combination ($9ish). The sashimi seemed pretty fresh and overall the food tasted good.The prices are pretty decent.. It's REALLY touristy though... My only complaint is the server we had that day... HATERRRRR
author: Jess K.

description: The fish was very fresh at this restaurant, but the rice was completely WRONG.  As stated in wikipedia: "In Japanese cuisine, sushi is vinegared rice, usually topped with other ingredients, including fish, various meats, and vegetables."  If the rice isn't vinegared, it's not sushi.  The rice they used was regular plain rice, the stuff that people cook at home.  If that were fixed (and it should be a very easy fix), it would be a decent place to get sushi.
author: Lyn Y.

description: I did not planned to eat at Sushi Rock but walking back from the gym I saw the sign on Polk street and get in by myself to try the place. Miso soup always welcome hot soup at as the starter of almost any meal. Sashimi combo was nice as a selection of fresh Sashimi, the plate offer only few pieces even so i was hungry it still did the job. Salmon with soy sauce was also good with quality presentation. Of course I had hot tea with the meal. the cost was ok, middle rank no too high but also not cheap.
author: Jackie K.

description:
Good view, but can't same the same for the food. 

I came here for the friends birthday hoping for excellent Japanese food, but we were pretty disappointed. I love Japanese food, but this place definitely doesn't stand out from many other Japanese restaurants. We tried all sorts of sushi and some were really good, but most of them were just average. It was just an alright experience, maybe I'm a little bias but every time I go out to eat Japanese food, either my wallet gets five pounds lighter or I leave feeling hungry. This time, I left feeling hungry.

3 people and $60 dollars later, left feeling hungry. 
Fill up on the green tea.

Vegetarian Friendly? 3 out of 10
Only a few items were vegetarian.
author: Willie F.

description:
the service is good and the place isn't too expensive under sushi standards. i took my out-of-town friends here and they liked the food as well (one of them NEVER tried sushi before in his life and he actually liked it as well) they gave us delicious miso soup but it was pretty standard miso soup- nothing spectacular. however, i proceeded to try the mango spider roll. then my mind was blown away- it was simply amazing. omg!

afterwards, they gave us coconut ice cream which was a nice pleasant surprise since we didn't know we would get complimentary miso soup AND ice cream :) the atmosphere is very relaxed and casual so you can really enjoy your sushi. they also have a huge flat screen tv on the side walls so you can keep up with football scores while you enjoy your yummy japanese grub. i definitely will come back here again.
author: The Hangry Chef O.

description: Not the greatest Sushi joint to hit up.  If your looking for something Sushi tasting good, this isn't the best place to go.  The other day I ate there for dinner.  Each time I eat there it's always the same.  Last time I ate there, I tried their Dynamite and Alaska roll.  To many cucumbers in their Dynamite roll and not enough Hamachi.  It looked presentable, noticeable enough that cucumbers took over the roll. Alaska roll wasn't that presentable.  It had very little salmon.  The servers are pretty slow and it took them awhile to take our order.  The flat screen will fix the wait.  The environment had a colorful feeling. It's a big restaurant, enough to bring a good amount of folks.   For reasonable prices, Sushi Rock isn't to bad.  As far as quality goes, try another sushi joint that's sushi-tasting-delicious.
author: Tiffany D.

description: I LOVE the hamachi kama here. I've tried hamachi kama at alot of places and this place definitely makes it very well. The sushi is also pretty good and at reasonable prices.
author: Amy M.

description: I really want to like coming here since I get a 15% off coupon on the back of my (marina) safeway receipt & it's just a couple blocks from work ...except I went on Friday and the fish seemed like it had an intense amount of color added. It just didn't seem possible that the tuna and salmon were naturally that bright. Otherwise though... I thought the food and service were fine. As someone said, the bathroom was a little dark and so makes you wonder about the kitchen.
author: Caitlin B.

description: The sushi we ordered from here was not fresh. We were lucky enough not to eat enough to get sick.
author: T G.

description:
stopped by for dinner a couple months ago before i started yelping, so here's wat i can recall:

tabletop felt a bit grimy when we were seated.
ordered two fancy-name rolls.
both were ABSOLUTELY FLAVORLESS.
ingredient weren't fresh, just dull and mushy.
rice content per roll was way high, for those who love carbs.
service doesn't care much to check up on u.  i wanted to leave so bad after killing the food as to not waste money, but it took another 10 minutes to flag down a waitress. no kidding, 10 minutes.  our waitress was nowhere to be seen.  keep in mind, the restaurant was less than 25% occupied.

total damage was about $26 for CRAAAAAP.
i swear, cheaper generic rolls u can find at safeway tastes slightly better.  heck, if Walgreens Sushi opened up next door, i'd probably dine with them than to give sushi rock another shot.  it's that bad.

but hey!  ONE STAR for broadcasting football... wat a clever distraction!  8(

for an awesome name like "sushi rock", and a prime location at the gateway of chinatown, i got SUCKERED big time.
author: Ethan L.

description: Nice little drop-in place.  Decor is so so, but they do have some cool origami  inspired hanging light fixtures.  The complimentary miso soup was bleh, but the pickled wakame (seaweed) was pretty yummy.  The  saba (mackrel) sashimi I had was actually very good.  Decent sized and fresh.  They also offer a full bar with filter and unfiltered sake, wine and beer.  There's also free ice cream (green tea and mango) at the end of the meal, and you can't go wrong with that.
author: Mischen C.

description: After reading the other reviews I was prepared for a very mediocre experience; We were pleasantly surprised, and I will definitely be back. They have an amazing sake menu, and during happy hour all drinks are 50% off. We got hot house sake, and I had two Kirin Lights all for about $6.50. We got a bunch of rolls so we could eat family style - everything tasted pretty fresh. The Unagi was delicious. The highlight was the free ice cream at then end, not just because it was free. We got mango, jasmine green tea, and rum raisin. Oh my goodness they were the most authentic tasting flavors I have ever had anywhere. It was like they literally mushed a mango with cream and froze it. I think the rum raisin was my favorite, but they were all good. We didn't get any of the free appetizers that other reviewers have mentioned, so I wouldn't necessarily expect it next time. Our waitress was a little weird, and I think if it had been any busier she would have been pretty bad, but whatever.
author: Merrilee T.

description: I am not sure how people are able to give anything more than one star to this place.  I'm also not understanding how there are 3 of these restaurants open!  This place is disgusting.  It's the worst sushi i've ever tasted.  I would never recommend it to people who want fresh food.  They might as well open up a drive through and offer a $3.99 combo meal because the quality is analagous to a fast food joint.
author: Bharu J.

description: Overall the food is pretty good! They just have to be a little bit more tidy! The menu's are dirty. Their sake ware is chipped. Can be a little loud at times. I like their Hamachi sashimi!
author: Loren T.

description: Pretty good place a huge variety of rolls and has a happy hour nothing too exciting but you get like 25% off sushi or something also drink special. The atmosphere is sort of cafeteria like good for groups and rowdy crowds I would say. They have a whole spectrum with entrees and apps on the menu and also reasonably priced.
author: Olga P.

description: Here on business in SF and this is the worst sushi I have ever had in my life. The quality of the food is severely lacking and the waitress does not appear to want to be here today. Sacramento sushi beats this place all day everyday. I would expect better in San Francisco. Never again. I will eat my sushi in Sacramento.
author: Ursula W.

description:
No. Just no.

I've given Sushi Rock several chances because it would just be SO convenient for it to be good; they're located in Chinatown AND they deliver.

I've ordered in and sat at their precariously situated restaurant but Sushi Rock is just not quite fresh and not quite memorable. :/
author: A W.

description: I am comletely satisfied with a three star rating for this place. The complimentary miso soup and the cucumber and seaweed appetizer was tasty. Not a bad place for a quick dinner and some decent sushi at a reasonable price.
author: Walter B.

description: Not so great. Food was so-so, service was pretty bad. It wasn't a life and death situation, but I would neither recommend it nor go there again.
author: P W.

description: Though I live across the street from Sushi Rock I've only been twice--I'm just not that wowed by the food.  The rolls weren't that impressive and the udon was just okay.  I will say that they are more child friendly than some other San Francisco establishments.  I went with my boyfriend and his niece and they were accommodating to her needs.  One more note--don't order cocktails here... they're watered down.
author: Helen B.

description: Don't come in here thinking you're gonna get mind-blowing sushi, because you're not. But if you want/need a reliable place that's open late, has the ability to accommodate a large group, an extensive menu, fast service, and beer - this is it. Happy hour drink/food specials are good and they give you complimentary seaweed salad and soup at the start of the meal and ice cream at the end. Never had a bad experience, but you may want to take your business elsewhere if you are a Fancy Pants Sushi Snob.
author: Barbara K.

description: Decent place for cheap sushi.  I've always gotten take-out -- one problem with take-out or delivery is that if your order is too large, they will always deliver fewer items than what you ordered ... they never err on the side of more.   The beef teriyaki and salmon sashimi are tolerable.
author: Chaz N.

description: I had dinner yesterday.  This has been my second time here.  The bento box was not too big and the food wasnt great.  The sashimi slices were super thick and kind of warm.  Also, the tempura was small.  Each piece was so small! They give you one small shrimp and four small pieces of vegetable.  It is cheap but not too good. =(
author: Carol K.

description: Must-go! This is pretty much the only BEST sushi joint in the Nob Hill area. i come here with a bunch of friends, and the food is great. I always go for the "Happy Box" their lunch special. It's great! Love when you sit down, you get served with a seaweed salad and some miso soup. Cheap for the great food! GREAT SERVICE. This waiter accidently split some soy sauce on me while cleaning up, it was no big deal, but he insisted on treating me to some great PollyAnn greentea ice cream and a Sushi Rock Calendar. Talk about great service! I love it here!
author: Jenny L.

description:
- alright sushi
- nice staff
- good place for casual lunch
author: ashley h.

description: Ok...I give these people 3 stars purely out of convenience...even though it's usually not that convenient. the sushi is OK, the online order site has been DOWN for at least 3 months, and there's a debate as to whether their takeout minimum is $15 or $20 (the pine street location) because they falsely advertise everywhere. Their special roles aren't that special, but hey, you get what you pay for.....if you CAN order it....if you meet their minimum delivery requirement....and are willing to wait an hour.
author: Johanna S.

description: I have only had this sushi via delivery, so I am not sure how it is fresh from the restaurant, but both times I've had sushi delivered it's been terrible. Soggy, funky, just overall gross. I'm gonna pass on this next time and just get my ass off the couch and walk to my local sushi place where I know it's always good.
author: K N.

description: The sushi is eh, but gotta love those happy hour specials. I hit this place when I'm in the neighborhood and it's between 3:30 and 6:30 p.m. (50% off drinks, 25% off appetizers). Everything tastes better when the drinks are 50% off.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: I've been to this sushi restaurant many times. The sushi is good because of the price. I can eat here everyday. The Hamachi Kama can be hit or miss depending on what day it is. Sometimes it's big enough, sometimes it can be scrawny. This place is best for lunch. The service can be inconsistent, as there tend to be more than the normal rate of turnover amongst the service staff.
author: Adrian J.

description: Went there last week for dnner. Amazing sushi and sashimi, fresh white tuna and oysters. Got the pheonix roll because their dragon roll did not come with shimp tempura. A little pricy but my mom works near by and they gave 20% off which was nice. Not sure why this place is rated so low but my experience could have been better because they recognised my mom. free ice creme at the end!
author: Robert S.

description: This place is an OK place to get japanese food, way better than kitaro, but it still isn't the best japanese food I had ever had. This place has a nice varieties of sushi to choose from and also the bentos have a great selection. The service here isn't the best, but what can you say... The food here is alright, the parking here is alright as well, they give you 2 hours free when you park in the "old garage" a half-block down. You must get the ticket validated in order to get it for free. If you don't want to do that, have fun finding parking on the street. Overall this place is alrigth, nothing to go "ga-ga" for...
author: Johnny T.

description:
I stopped here for some take-out sushi while in town on business. I'm sure there must be better sushi places in SF, probably at a lower price point to boot.

Pros: 
 - close-ish to financial district/SOMA hotels
 - take-out service was quick and friendly
 - sushi was edible - nothing to write home about, but satisfied a sudden raw fish craving

Cons: 
 - flavor/quality was so-so
 - assembly was sloppy (nigiri oddly cut in half, apparently by accident)
 - somewhat overpriced
 - place smelled funny
author: Scott V.

description: I loved the fact that the wait staff knew me by name.  I had only been going there a few times while I worked in the neighborhood.  Always left with a ice cream on the house - wow... good service as well.
author: Benjamin B.

description: The salmon tartare is fantastic, just melt in your mouth goodness.  The rest of our meal was just ok.  The sushi rolls didn't have the best flavor combinations but the fish was fresh.  Not the best but better than most snobby sushi places.
author: Nathan B.

description: I came here a few times and had a pleasant experience. I don't order sushi rolls here, I come just for the bento box lunches. You get what you pay for 3 items for $7.95. This is a good place for a quick bite. The lunch selection has enough variety and the service is quick. This is a casual place to eat with a bunch of friends on a budget. Some areas in the restaurant could use some paint and tidying up.
author: Candace F.

description: This place is a pretty basic. I have received mediocre service and the food is pretty predictable. It's kind of a necessity in this neighborhood, so that way when you get home at 9:00, don't feel like cooking, you can depend on sushi rock to deliver just what you were expecting - and thankfully in a timely manner! So, all in all I don't go out of my way to eat here, but I am glad that it is here. Hope this helps...
author: Dash H.

description:
The girls and I pile into Big White to trek in from San Ramon to use a gift certificate.  Shawna made reservations that seemed totally unnecessary as it wasn't packed when we arrived or left and we parked right in front of the restaurant.  We tried to order a bottle of sake but they didn't have the first two Shawna selected out of the sake portfolio.  I have no clue what we even ended up with.  I just know that it was okay at the start of the bottle but it got a whole lot better by the end.

I only had sushi once before and that was when I could still eat shrimp (stupid shellfish allergy!)  We had a massive amount of food.  Soup
Cucumber seaweed salad
Edamame
String bean tempura-light ginger dipping sauce
Vegetable tempura-excuse for more ginger dipping sauce
Makimono rolls: avocado, Philadelphia, Tamago, and one I couldn't eat.
Hamachi Sashimi
Just barely coconut ice cream...

Everything was yummy!   The string bean tempura was better than the vegetable.  If you can't eat shellfish, the avocado and tamago rolls were better than staying home.  The avocado roll was better in my opinion.  I don't like the texture of coconut but it didn't interfere.  The ice cream had a coconut flavor that I could describe only as soft.
author: Jenna W.

description: The sushi here was definitely below average - the rolls were less than impressive and the fish did not have the freshness I would've expected for a decently priced sushi restaurant. The lunch specials looked like they would be a good deal for the price, but I had and can only speak to the sushi I had for dinner. Try your luck elsewhere.
author: Willy C.

description:
People review based on their motivations. For those seeking a good happy hour experience, this place might do the trick, but if you're looking for quality sushi, do yourself a favor and avoid Sushi Rock. How would I explain it...its kind of like the day-after rack at Safeway.

Sushi is one of those all-or-nothing dishes. If its not 100% fresh and high quality, it will taste like socks. and good quality doesnt need to be pricey either. Unfortunately, Sushi Rock delivers on the nothing.

The service is more than attentive, and they do have some pretty generous perks like free miso and ice cream, plus a discounting. Its unfortunate that the food just doesnt match.
author: Deuce B.

description:
um..............white people sushi
like.....um ...almost fast food................yehk!
bad service is a compliment, the only way i could get the waitresses attention, after about four tries, was waiving a napkin on a chopstick like a flag.
we then did what we should have in the first place and got dim sum in Chinatown.
author: Adam F.

description: Sushi was ok, but the place was not. Too pushy with "loud top hits" music - not something that I would expect at this type of setting. Neither would not go back nor recommend to anyone. You are much better off heading into china town and visiting a small dumpling place instead.
author: Ala M.

description: It is what it is.  And what it is, is a place to get a huge platter of sashimi for around $15.00.  The platter is a ten-piece assortment of five kinds of fish and comes with miso soup, sea-weed salad and ice cream.  They will even substitute the octopus for something else...most of the time.
author: Chris S.

description:
sushi rock opened near my house around 5-7 years ago... i've anticipated my day to finally go there... and after years of anticipation.. i come out with disappointment... the restaurant is really not as lively as the name makes it sound.. and the food is not that good.. it was pretty plain..   there are soo many sushi places cheaper and better than sushi rock.. sushi rock does not live up to it's name...

-x3 shells
author: Lily X.

description: Really dissaapointed to have made the mistake to have ordered delivery from here. Either Grubhub continues to be desparate or this was a standard flub.  Every roll was outside in.  It was very low quality and overpriced.  Bascically, pretty much was not good.. Just another reason why the city of san francisco will eventually be a dust bowl.
author: T G.

description: I got one of the lunch combos. I can't remember the price but it wasn't too expensive, a little high perhaps. The sushi wasn't bad, but it wasn't too good either. What really knocks this place down to 2 stars is the blaring house music: I felt like I was in a Tijuana nightclub. Lame.
author: Alex P.

description:
I have eaten here three time now and have enjoyed it.  I usually order sushimi and have found it to be quite reasonable in cost, very fresh and delicious.  Plus these people treat you like customers.  They are very friendly and accomodating.  I love the bottle of organic sake, especially during half price happy hour.

The only downside so far was during my last visit.  I had the grilled sea bass and it was very, very salty.  But I will be back for sushimi.

PS, on my second visit, they remembered me from my first.  Impressive!
author: John H.

description: I don't usually go out to sushi places with co-workers dreading that I won't find anything but avocado rolls to eat. But, Sushi Rock had more then enough for me to choose from and will take me multiple trips to get through all the stuff I want to try. Quality was good and I thought the price was fair for what I got, especially since I couldn't finish it all.  Looking forward to the next gray day so that i can get satisfy my Udon cravings..
author: Rob F.

description:
Reasonable price, fresh sushi, fast service. I love it. 

The decor felt a bit like a cafe rather than a restaurant. 

I would go back
author: Kathy P.

description: Tuna roll was good but the Godzilla roll was too creamy.  The edimame was nice with sea salt.  I got a teriyaki beef and rice bowl, which was average.  Meat was overcooked.  Setting is on the relaxed side, nothing fantastic but nice.
author: Jason M.

description: We come here often for their happy lunch box because the service is quick and friendly. My favourites in the lunch box are gyoza, saba & avocado rolls.
author: Bettina O.

description:
went here for lunch. got the cold noodle bowl w/ beef and a caterpillar roll. the bowl was pretty bland and light on steak, although the steak was good. it came with a sweet sesame sauce that added some flavor to the dish, but would have made it too sweet if i put more in.
the caterpillar roll had the unagi on the inside with avocado on the outside, as opposed to what i'm used to with alternating avocado and unagi on the outside. it resulted in less unagi and more avocado, which wasn't too cool w/ me.
the other people in my group made similar comments about the food not being very good. even the miso soup was rejected.
since there are other choices nearby, i don't see myself coming back here.
author: AJ C.

description: Do not eat here. Tried to stay with cooked items but even those were inedilbe. Dirty.
author: Judy S.

description: I've ordered from these folks via GrubHub a number of times, always with reasonable results. Tonight the results were so awful that I won't be ordering from these folks again.  The maguro was literally so tough that it would have required a steak knife to cut it properly.  This is at $4.50 per PIECE/ $9 for two.  The fish wasn't toxic/smelly/bad - it was just tough as New York ribeye.  The the salmon was better but not by much.  Never again.
author: Rob R.

description: Not the best sushi joint in town, but it's fairly cheap and the service is quick. I usually end up getting the udon which is quite tasty, but I've had the sushi a few times. Wayo a couple blocks away is a bit better and quite a bit calmer.
author: John P.

description: This is the place to go if you want cheap and big portions.  I've never seen any sushi roll so huge or sashimi so thick (thick but not good).  They serve the typical bento boxes, sushi rolls, sashimi, etc. which are decent but if you want good fresh sashimi, do not go there.  You'll be so disappointed cause the salmon and albacore sashimi they brought out was still half frozen.
author: Kate L.

description: I thought this placed looked good based on how busy it was but I was sadly mistaken.  Their menu seemed ok and the decor was adequate, but the quality, portion, and appearance of the food was horrific.  My friend and I ordered the una-ebi roll and the futo-maki roll to begin with, and that ended it for us.  First of all, the service was slow and they forgot the egg in the futo-maki and we had to have it sent back.  Secondly, the pieces were too thin and few to even constitute an entire "roll" of sushi.  Thirdly, the sushi looked horrible, unevenly cut, pieces of the filling sticking out everywhere, etc.  Lastly, the sushi tasted horrible - the rice was too gooey, the inside of the futo-maki included very non-standard vegetables and their flavors didn't blend well, there wasn't enough rice-wine vinegar, and the entire thing was lacking in flavor.  We were really upset at this place.  Anyone who knows even moderately good Japanese food knows this place is an embarrassment to San Francisco...
author: K K.

description: the place has a great look to it, not your traditional sushi restaurant and i don't think i've ever had to wait to long to get seated.  so, good service is a plus.
author: Hong T.

description: I would love to give this place a zero rating, but I guess it isn't possible.  I have had sushi all over the country and you would think that being that San Francisco is right on the ocean, and a major metropolitan area with a large Japanese and Chinese population, that the sushi would be excellent!  Unfortunately, this was the worst I've ever experienced and I could hardly choke it down - if I hadn't been starving, I don't think I could have managed it.  The rice was overcooked in my rolls - soggy and warm with no seasoning at all.  The inner ingredients were only identifiable by color, not by texture or flavor.  We had three different rolls and none of them were palatable.  The Beijing roll had duck (I'm guessing) and a horrible sauce.  My softshell crab was soggy.  My daughter's miso soup bowl had some encrusted filth on the outside.  They didn't serve hot tea - only water was complimentary.  And the bathrooms????   Filthy and no soap.  The restaurant was not very clean.  I had to stand up to signal them that I needed our bill, even though only three tables had patrons.  The only upside was that we enjoyed watching the shoppers go by outside the windows.  There is a better Sushi bar down the street (north) a couple of blocks, so if you are in the mood for sushi, keep walking!
author: C T.

description: for inexpensive japanese, this place is solid.  7.95 for a three item bento box is boner time.  they also give you free miso and some seaweed salad thing.  for the price, good value.
author: boner time j.

description: I actually wound up here on accident.  A friend of mine had told me I had to check out Sushi Rock because it was really good.  When I came to SF to visit my boyfriend, I made sure to go here.  I have to admit, I was a little disappointed.  It was OK, nothing great...  I came home and was talking to my friend about it.  Apparently, she got the wrong name.  She thought SUSHI GROOVE was really good.  I haven't gotten a chance to check out the RIGHT restaurant, but I'm pretty sure it will be better than Sushi Rock!
author: Leslie R.

description: It's decent sushi. It's comfortable. It's affordable. And there's basketball on the TVs. I like it.
author: Aimee S.

description: this place sucks. we were suckered into their happy hour special on drinks and appetizers and i would wish we would have just gotten hot dogs off the street vendors. the fish is disgusting and the service is straight up terrible.
author: Matt R.
